Reviews.Title: “April 2012”
Reviews.Author: Rex L
Reviews.Content: Very good location as far as doing the tourist stuff and avail transport, clean hotel with excellent service. The buffet breakfast had lots of choices. Would recommend to familes too. We stayed 4 nights and the hotel gave us a free transport from airport to hotel (call ahead of time). Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “president hotel”
Reviews.Author: mardigrasUae
Reviews.Content: Had a 3 day break in Istanbul. Without realising it, I had been to this hotel 5 years ago. Good 4 star facilities, however the room was quite small but adequate for our use. Good touristic location for all sites to visit in walking distance. Unlike previous comments I did not think the breakfast was up to 4 star status. I found it quite limiting. For anyone wanting to use the pool for swimming this would have been impossible as it is only a 'plunge' pool. My only gripe was the day on leaving we were subjected to maintenance being done on the floor above - drilling going on for hours. A note was pushed through the door to say they would move us if we wanted to rest. This was a tad too late as although I had booked and paid for 3 nights, my flight status had changed and needed to leave 9pm that night, so really didnt want to pack and move room at this short notice. Knowing that I had a change of flight and being through the night I wanted to rest in the afternoon....but couldnt!!!

Reviews.Title: “Breakfast with fantastic view”
Reviews.Author: keklenz
Reviews.Content: We have booked this hotel directly quite upfront our journey to Istanbul and got a very competitive rate including 1 airport transfer and 1 spa access per person. Extremely convenient location close to all ancient sites and many restaurants (Grand Bazar, Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Beyazit & Sulthanamet, Kumkapi fishing village - all in walking distance). Excellent and helpful staff, also before the actual stay. The offered family room was indeed 2 fully equipped double rooms with two bathrooms andconnecting doors. Very clean, well equipped with comfortable beds, coffee&tea making facilities and quiet at night. Side view to the sea. Classically furnished, not extremly modern and not a design hotel style but you feel immediately very comfortable in the room The breakfast room is located on the 6th floor and offers a fantastic panorama view which we enjoyed every morning. The breakfast buffet is at least 10 metres long and offers a huge variety of good food. Coffee is unfortunately - same as in almost all hotels now - from one of these machines where coffee does not really taste well. Another highlight - also if you travel with children like we did - is the indoor pool on the 7th floor. It is not large but sufficient and nice to visit after many hours of walk in the town. A bit strange that there is no dividing wall between the bar and the pool. We also enjoyed the small spa with sauna, jacuzzi and steam bath which was wonderful after a long cold day with rainy weather. Pool and small fitness room are free of charge, the spa does cost extra. Also on the 7th floor you have two sun terraces with even nicer view than in the breakfast room. We have not visited the hotel restaurants due to the huge variety of nice and affordable restaurants in the area. Guest are offered a welcome drink in the English pub on ground floor. Another reason why we chose this hotel is, that it is constructed in an earthquake-proof way. I would always recommend this hotel and would come back when we visit Istanbul next time. I have stayed at a different hotel some years ago which was very traditional, much more expensive but the beneftis of Best Western The President are so convincing that I do not want to try different places.

Reviews.Title: “Stress Free and Fun with a few Quirks”
Reviews.Author: Ben728
Reviews.Content: We were met at the airport by a man holding a sign with our name on it, who took us to a shuttle directly to the hotel (part of the package we booked). The hotel is in the Beyazit district, not far west from Sultanahmet, on a very steep and interesting street (the immediate neighborhood is populated by a mix of small leather merchants with all sorts of gods). Just south of the hotel is a large restaurant area with a big variety of choices. Just beyond that is the waterfront with, of course, even more restaurants. It's a fun location, and you can walk to all the major locations or get on the tram line, which has a big stop just up the street, where you can also find currency exchange (at better rates than the hotel) and all kinds of other shops and restaurants. Our room was good size and very clean. The hotel provides bottled water every day, as tap water may not be safe to drink (there are warning signs). The front desk staff is very friendly and seemed to speak decent English and French, although there were some struggles (we had to speak with the concierge to clear up a few items). The breakfast bar is very nicely set up on a high floor, where you have a great ocean front view of the beautiful sunrises. The top floor has a nice restaurant that we didn't have a chance to try, and a great outdoor bar. The pool is also located up there and it is very nice, although not exactly in a quiet area. There is a business center where you can log in and check e-mails, etc (the computers are old, but adequate). All the personnel were very courteous and accommodating and seemed to have a good sense of humor. On our last day there, I got locked out on one of the roof top decks for some reason, and had to come down the interior fire escape. I didn't realize that I had tripped the fire door alarm and was greeted by a breathless security guard with a walky talkie asking "You OK, You're not burning??). When I tried to explain what happened, he seemed to understand immediately and we both had a laugh. The concierge, whom we we had gotten to know said "You check out today, no?" with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: Topplanner
Reviews.Content: Hotel is sited in an excellent location, off a main street. Within walking distance of a number of historical sites including Blue Mosque,Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia and the Grand Bazaar. Hotel service was excellent, and our room was clean and spacious. Restaurant on the 6th floor provided a great choice of food at breakfast, accompanied by wonderful views over the city. Very atmospheric bar on the ground floor, adjacent to the reception, which we enjoyed visiting, after a day out sightseeing. Our room (113) above the main entrance was noisier due to daily street activities occurring early in the morning. This did not bother us as this is part of Istanbul life.- However not to everyones liking.

Reviews.Title: “Simply outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Worldwiide2012
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, beautifully decorated, and great ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “great location, but not really a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: mina k
Reviews.Content: first of all, the service is very polite and the location is pretty central. the rooms were clean and the breakfast was lovely with both turkish and continental options. honeycomb and halva were more than enoughg to satisfy my morning sweet tooth. i know it is difficult to accomodate 3 travelers, but putting cot in a 2-person room with only a sheet (instead of a comforter like the other 2 beds) and 2 towels made me feel like an afterthought. when we requested a comforter the next morning, we were (politely) assured that we would receive it. late that evening we returned to our room to find it cleaned, but still with a sheet and only 2 towels. we were too tired and just wanted to sleep so we did not call reception about the comforter. in the end, the thin walls and high temperature in the hotel kept us up most of the night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Regi86
Reviews.Content: Overall I thought the hotel was great for a 4 star hotel Rooms are clean, friendly staff, minutes from the historical sights and shopping. Amazing breakfasts - danishes, cereal, eggs, variety of cold cuts and cheeses, some veggies and olives, jams and halva. One complaint though, the walls are thin and we could hear all the activities in the next room. We would go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location near the Grand Bazaar”
Reviews.Author: lmorodomi
Reviews.Content: Easy walk to the Grand Bazaar. Nice view from the breakfast room. Decent food in all the restaurants. Rooms were clean. The only negative is they keep the temperature in the entire hotel on ultra hot, but we found that to be the case at all the hotels in Turkey, thank goodness the windows opened. You could definitely hear the calls to prayer, but fortunately for me, I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A Good Hotel in A Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Explorer_Geo
Reviews.Content: Frankly speaking, after a not the best experience with Best Western Hotels in Montreal and Toronto just a week before, I was not sure what to expect from the same chain hotel in Istanbul. Nevertheless, I must admit I was surprised in a very positive way - hotel has got a very good location, good branding and professional appearance (including staff professionalism). Room was also cosy and very nicely decorated - balcony with a view to the sea was a great addition. There is also a very good pub inside the hotel and every guest enjoys a free welcome cocktail. All in all, a very good value you get for the reasonable price you pay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!!!”
Reviews.Author: Armughan
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at The President on New Year 2012 eve (from 30th Dec - 4th Jan). The President occupies a great surrounding; you can walk to Sultanahmet Mosque, Aya Sofia, Grand Bazar and a lot of fantastic restaurants. Plus, it rests very close to Beyazit metro station as well. Staff are very courteous, welcoming and helpful. We highly recommend this hotel for those whom are planning a fun trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great LOCATÄ°ON”
Reviews.Author: BelindaT927
Reviews.Content: stay at this hotel was a beautiful gift, and an unfrgettable experience. Exceptional service, beautiful rooms and views of Ä°stanbul, absolutely stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Old City”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidVenturer
Reviews.Content: A very good hotel located just 200m from the Grand Bazar and T1 tram line. MOdern and well kept. Only hotel with an "English" pub in Istanbul (their claim to fame) - but why got to Istanbul for a pint when there are lots of fantastic coffee shops and restaurants? Good buffet breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: AlvaroB82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the best western when we upgraded our hotel through gate one travels. The only complain we had is the first night they overbooked the hotel so we had to stay at the hotel across the street which was no big deal and they made up for it in spades. The hotel sent over a very nice set of flower and when we went back to the best western the next day, they had our rooms ready along with the a very nice fruit basket and a bottle of wine. On top of that they treated us to some drinks at their bar, a day at their spa and an amazing meal at the rooftop terrace restaurant which I would recommend to everyone. In the morning the buffet breakfast is reason enough to stay there with a vast selection of food for even the pickiest of eaters and a nice view overlooking the sea. The staff was always ready to help and if anything the cleaning staff was a bit too eager to clean the room but that is probably our fault for not putting up the do not disturb sign. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and everyone and given as we loved Istanbul and want to go back, I will keep them at the top of the list for our next trip. Also the hotel is no more than a 10 to 15 minute walk from the Hagia Sophia, hippodrome and bazaar. We were there for only 4 days so there was not enough time to see everything. On a side note, everything was booked through Gate One travel which I have recommended to all our friends. I expected so much less and got so much more than we had bargained for.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: RoseChiee
Reviews.Content: My friend and I spent 5nights at the Best Western in December. We booked a double room with 2 beds and we found tha rooms quite small for 2 people and the walls are very thin, you can actually here people talking next door which was a little disturbing, however the hospitality was good. The room was clean and pleasant. The staff were very helpful and efficient. Breakfast was good and had a lot to choose from. Hotel location is very good and close to the Tram station and the Grand Bazzar as well as local tourist attractions. We will definitely return. I highly recommend the Best Western to anyone who is looking for a luxury but affordable stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Style at an affordable price”
Reviews.Author: lifeistooshortWirral
Reviews.Content: My sister and I spent 2 night at the President in August 2011. Although the lifts were being replaced during our stay the disruption was kept to a minimum. We were also impressed by the speed at which the work was being carried out. The room was very pleasant and commensurate with the hotels ranking. Upon checking in we asked for a sea view and the concierge obliged but said it might take an hour to prepare. Whilst we waited we were served cocktails at the rooftop bar. This is probably the best bit of the hotel with an indoor swimming pool and large sun deck with loungers and a pletiful supply of clean towels. There is direct access one floor down to the well equipt gym and spa. The views of the city from the rooftop are simply amazing. There is also a smart restaurant on the roof however we found it a little pricey for our wallets and didn't try it. We had booked a bed and breakfast rate and the buffet style breakfast had more than enough choice and was well worth it. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and in fact I am planning to revisit for a couple of days this spring.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast and wifi included plus helpful service”
Reviews.Author: OzTrip17
Reviews.Content: Great breakfast served in room overlooking Marmara Sea. Wifi included but signal strength not always good in rooms (good in public areas though). Staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “An average experience at this hotel , you could do better”
Reviews.Author: Snayyar1
Reviews.Content: The rooms are clean but that's about it . If you want any vegetarian food you re in for hard times . The hotel staff werent too helpful in arranging any dishes for you ...except there was this girl on the from desk .. Forget her name but she was too sweet n helpful about where to go .. Over all an okay experience ...must be better hotels in the same price . Location wise close to sultanhemet n grand bazaar .

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a good price!”
Reviews.Author: ceciQ-63
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The President Hotel and our experience was very good. We did not expect a fancy place, but something nice,clean, good sized and good location, and the President had it all! It is located one block away from the Bazaar, walking distance from all attractions in the historical (old) part of Istanbul. People were extremely friendly, breakfast on the rooftop was very good and varied. A great variety of pastry shops and restaurans around... At The President, we fell at home, safe. CanÂ´t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “no need for more”
Reviews.Author: Yasserradwan
Reviews.Content: it was my first visit to istanbul and i think this hotel can make you want to visit thousand of time . really marvelous hotel location was the best near metro station that can take you to all parts of istanbul to hagia sophia and blue mosques grand bazzar taksim square , indeed i didnt have to take this metro because it is a walking distance to hagia sophia and blue mosque and grand bazzaar and other attration . service we marvelous and staff was unseen to disturb but was seen by there they were so helpful and smiling face and very fast to get ur service . room was very clean and comfortable , they have more than restaurants but i tried 2 only in floor and terrace restaurant which was woow i like there hasan a nice waiter although he isnt the best to take a photo of u ( funny ) but he was nice and helpful also they had MR BURAK which without knowing me he offered me all his information and help before arrival to make my visit more happy thanks for him last this was the recepionanist mrs TURAY i think she was very cheerfull

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul or ..”
Reviews.Author: Howard-Moon
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel conveniently located in the â€˜old townâ€™. All the main tourist attractions within easy walking distance. Beyazit Tram station 2 minutes walk up the hill giving good access to the â€˜new townâ€™. Staff very helpful, couple of minor issues dealt with very quickly and very efficiently. Room a little on the small side but more than adequate and clean. Good breakfast served on 6th floor with great views over the sea. Check in/out very quick and efficient. We found the hotel a little too hot â€“ but may be just their reaction to the outside temperature, but did make it a little uncomfortable when using the restaurant and â€˜Englishâ€™ pub (bit representative of the 70â€™s). Can see how some reviewers have complained about noise, walls are very thin and adjoining rooms and corridors can easily be overheard. Main issue is bathrooms are back to back so can be overheard â€“ solvable by keeping bathroom door closed. We were fortunate to have room at end of corridor â€“ so only one adjacent neighbour. Restaurants within easy walking distance down bottom of hill - Kumkapi â€“ one pedestrian street with nothing but restaurants â€“ carry on under tramline and over main road to fish market on the dock and further fish restaurants. Lack of decent bars in local area. Take one of the many tours to take in the main attractions â€“ avoids the queues on entry and guides are font of all knowledge Donâ€™t miss the Cistern (not usually on the guided tours) â€“ well worth a visit â€“ very atmospheric Donâ€™t neglect the â€˜new townâ€™. Dolmabachce Palace worth a visit (next to Besiktas' Stadium â€“ try to avoid local derby with Galatasary â€“ we didnâ€™t) Take one of the Funicular lines up to Tulim Square/Istiklal Cad â€“ very busy bit like Oxford Street/London with many shops and bars/restaurants on side streets Walk down the hill from Tunel Square , more speciality shops. Recommend â€˜Enginarâ€™ near tower as place to eat Galata tower â€“ good views over the city and great photo opportunity from the top Watch the hoards of fishermen from Galata Bridge. Small fish market on â€˜new town, side â€“ fresh fish/whitebait cooked to order. Many restaurants on lower deck of bridge. Grab a fish sandwich (5TL) served from the boats on the â€˜old townâ€™ side â€“ definitely beats McDonalds Top Tip: Explore Good hotel but would recommend staying in â€˜new townâ€™ to friends knowing what we know now â€“ bit more life in the evenings and very easy access to the â€˜old townâ€™ via the trams.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: jmbranco
Reviews.Content: Very good room, excellent breakfast, good price. But limited service (nobody heed me at all to find good fuinha to do in the city), and noisy room. Walking distance from grand bazaar, but a bit far from the mosques. Next time i will prefer to stay in a hotel between mosques and bazar, lime crowne plaza Sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Fond Memories in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SuzieQ84
Reviews.Content: We've found BW Plus The President Hotel one of the true "hidden treasures". Being there for 5 nights, the hotel is well located just minutes from the the "Old Town", easily accessible to all sights by walking or just 2-3 minutes from the tram stop on the "main drag". Many wonderful local restaurants which offer supurb Turkish cuisine or many seafood restaurants down the hill, very very convenient for shopping if you love to explore the "Grand Bazaar". The roof top restaurant offers varieties of breakfast choices , fine quality but the place could be a bit crowded depending on the time you rise, beautiful view is the plus. The hotel overall is not "fancy" yet value for money is really worthwhile. The front desk staff, Mr. Ali, together with the rest of them are very helpful and courtious. My compliment also goes to Mr. Niyazi, the porter who showed us the true Turkish hospitality. Enjoy our sights and sounds of Istanbul and will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Istanbul!!!”
Reviews.Author: vivivacation
Reviews.Content: I spent 03 nights once again at this hotel in last August and was very nice again!!! The rooms are clean, despite they are not so large. Wifi free and the breakfast was plenty of variety and the view for the ocean is great!!! The location is good for whose want to stay near the Grand Baazar, about 05 minutes walking. As I prefer to stay at the old area of Istanbul, this place is perfect. If you need any assistance, donÂ´t hesitate to call Mr. Selami TaÅŸkÄ±n, very kind man, the front office manager.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, helpful staff....”
Reviews.Author: Joanneharris
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the President for a week and found the rooms very clean and adequate. The staff could not do enough to help with any request. Coffee/Tea making facilities in room and satellite T.V. The restaurants were good and the food OK for this star of hotel. I loved the English Bar and the bar staff were good fun and very helpful. Do try to book the Belly Dancer and traditional dancers show next door it's good fun. The hotel is very close to all the attractions Ayasofia/Blue Mosque, etc. Overall I really enjoyed my stay and would definately use it again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: West Palm Beach, Florida, United States
Reviews.Title: “Cruise start in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Robert L
Reviews.Content: I found that our stay at the President Hotel in Istanbul very satisfying! I would stay there again should the need to travel in the area be required.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the President Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: carlojo
Reviews.Content: No problems with stay at all. Rooms are the size you would expect at a European hotel and the bed was better than I expected. The selection of pillows was two feather and two synthetic. I don't think that there are many rooms in the hotel that have a water view, but a few do. If you don't have the view in your room there are plenty of terraces on the upper floors. Breakfast selection was large (but if you are an American expecting bacon and eggs you might not be 100% satisfied everyday). Staff were all very helpful. Rooms have both AC and heat. Location is just five minute walk from the Grand Bazaar, but half of it is uphill ... was not a problem for me, but if you are not used to walking everyday you should have some sensible shoes. Halfway between the Bazaar and the Hotel are the city trams. In a perfect world, I wish this was between the Grand Bazaar and the Sofia Hagia: I wish I could move the hotel, as I doubt there is a hotel as good as this in that area. As I was staying more than five nights the hotel provided one-way transportation from the airport to the hotel on my arrival - very nice of them.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, small, most basic rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Freal T
Reviews.Content: I liked all the staff, except person who seemed ignorant about Asians (gave priority to Europeans).The location for public transport is excellent. Morning breakfast items were limited but good. The room is really small for the price I paid for the hotel. The airconditioner was not working,The decor was most basic and ordinary.The room was very cramped for two people to move around with luggages on the floor .

Reviews.Title: “Another excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: William035
Reviews.Content: I have been using the President hotel since 2002 and have always enjoyed my time here. This time the main restaurant was not open, but its menu was available in the terrace restaurant on the roof. Bedroom walls are a bit thin.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Chrislyn578
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent for a sightseeing trip to Istanbul - it is in a good location to visit all the top attractions in the city. Also very close to the trams, the Kopkapi resturant area and the fish market/resturants. We booked a junior suite and were upgraded to a Presidential suite - the staff were very friendly and efficient, the resturant was good, but it was too cold to enjoy the outside terrace with its magnificent views over the sea.

Reviews.Title: “Close to bazaar. Location, location,location”
Reviews.Author: lukejohnson
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel 4 star, service just ok. Rooms comfortable but simple. Housekeepers men kept knocking then apologizing. Close to grand bazaar and just down the hill is the most interesting area to eat. If you like the review please give helpful vote.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Would return again for sure!”
Reviews.Author: nick s
Reviews.Content: WE really enjoyed our stay here. Great location, we walked everywhere. WE never even had to take the metro or a taxi (we where only here 2 days). The staff was great. THE ROOMS WERE SUPER QUIET!!

Reviews.Title: “'Excellent'”
Reviews.Author: Weegiewoman
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Location. Just up the road is the Grand Bazaar, and a few minutes walk away is the Blue Mosque. Close enough to all of the attractions, yet just off the busy main road so you can escape the hustle and the bustle when you want to. The hotel was lovely. Great rooms, which were spotlessly clean. Brilliant roof terrace with stunning views. Buffet breakfast was very good. Would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Visit the terrace restaurant”
Reviews.Author: CocktailMom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, it's very nicely appointed, the staff and service were excellent, and at the price we paid, it was a good value. I wish I could remember the name of concierge - she was very helpful and friendly and spoke flawless English. We especially enjoyed a great dinner in the restaurant on the terrace, with lovely views of the city, for our first night in Istanbul. The breakfast, which was included, was delicious, with lots of choices, including a few exotic items (for us Americans!) like cherry juice. Only minor quibble - we were on the third floor - and could hear noise from the street, which is pretty constant well into the evening, not to mention the 5:30 a.m. muezzin. But overall a wonderful place to stay. Tip: hire a private guide to show you around Istanbul, if you can afford it. We did and we were able to get so much more out of the experience. Email me if you want a recommendation.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Ness321
Reviews.Content: The staff are very friendly and efficient, the rooms are comfortable, the location is good (close to the Grand Bazaar and just a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque). There is a tram stop at the end of the street or very readily available taxis outside (even at 6am on a Sunday) if you want to go further afield. They provided a free pick up service from Istanbul airport as we were staying for 3 nights. My only gripe is that the soundproofing between the rooms isn't great.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and facilities”
Reviews.Author: andys15
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a package trip to Istanbul two weeks ago (Sept 2011). The room was quite small, without any particular view, but then looking at the hotel's usual rates, I think we had a good discount through the travel company, so could hardly expect the penthouse suite. Beds were comfortable and everything functioned as it should. What really impressed us was the location and views from the upper storeys where the rooftop restaurant, sun deck and fitness suite are situated. The view across the city overlooking the Sea of Marmara and the Blue Mosque is spectacular in the daytime and magical by night. The service from the staff was attentive, friendly and courteous at all times. It may be partly the exchange rate, but we found the hotel to be an excellent place to eat out in the evening. Istanbul is a fascinating historic city, but after the hustle and bustle of the day, we found it much easier to relax in the evening in the peace and tranquility of the hotel. Considering its proximity to the old city and major sights, the hotel is surprisingly peaceful. The fitness suite and pool are free of charge to use - the latter is just somewhere to splash around, but aren't most hotel swimming pools. There is a sauna and jacuzzi, but it does cost 10 euros a day to use. Finally, we found the hotel breakfast to be excellent - again great views from the dining room, and an excellent range of food from the buffet; kept us going till well past lunchtime! Overall, we felt this was definitely one the better hotels we have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: oswalsachin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel in July 2011. The location Of this Hotel is Good. Its Bang Opposite the Grand Bazar. The interiors of this hotel is very old. I stayed in A Standard room. The rooms is very small with no views at all. The T.V set was small with no english entertainment except for a few news channel. They have a english bar which had a good ambience though. The views from the top of the hotel is good. The service is also very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Pablo L
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms in an excellent location. Walking distance to the main historical places. Grand Bazaar is one block away in case your wife want to shop and you want to stay at the hotel for a rest. Rooms were nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: lalita24
Reviews.Content: In the old part of the city, beautiful lobby, good attention by personnel, superb food, and very good views of Istambul's buildings and the Bosforo.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Joseph7820
Reviews.Content: The Best Western - The President Hotel is a 4 star hotel, but it borders on being a 5 star hotel. It is in a great location. A short 2 block walk to the Grand Bazaar. Many other shops in the area. Also a short 2 block walk to the Metro Tram Station The rooftop Terrace Restaurant offers a fabulous view of the Marmara Sea and the boats that are anchored near the shore.. The staff at the Front Desk is very friendly and helpful in giving you directions to find a destination. I would certainly pick the Best Western - The President to stay during a future visit to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Sheyda A
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our family for four nights and besides the great location, good rooms, good breakfast, and nice terrace/lounge area, we found the staff to be most helpful. If you stay at the President, make sure you say hello to Tulay. She is one wonderful lady and goes out of her way to help with a lovely smile on her face.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Florin B
Reviews.Content: Excellent location with amazing panorama from 6th floor. Very close to touristic points of interest and Grand Bazaar. The pool and restaurant was amazing. Breakfast was very good. Next time when will goes in Istanbul will be back at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and amazing staff!!”
Reviews.Author: SydneyTravellers22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western for 5 nights in August '11. We had an amazing stay and were very impressed by the hotel and its staff. 1. Location - two mins walk from the Grand Bazaar, under ten mins to Blue Mosque and other amazing sights of Istanbul. Life is made even easier by the metro being literally one minute from the hotel. The location is perfect!!! 2. Breakfast - a very wide variety of food and was a very well staffed service. It's a much bigger breakfast than you'd expect for European culture and was delicious and had varying hot food each morning. 3. Room - basic facilities and amenities, yet the room (and bed) were still very comfortable. Our stay was made that little bit more amazing by our fantastic sea views from room 521. Housekeeping was efficient in cleaning our room each day. Overall, I would suggest this hotel to everyone. Just note for any guests staying here shortly, there is some elevator works happening. If you ignore this simple inconvenience, you've got yourself an amazing hotel near the beautiful sights of Istanbul. I hope you enjoy as much as we did. Finally, a big thank-you to the beautiful reception staff who were extremely helpful, and the doormen who were always up for a chat. Thanks Best Western for a great stay :)

Reviews.Title: “Generally very good”
Reviews.Author: andrewantenucci557
Reviews.Content: This was suprisingly great deal in Istanbul. Great rooms, amazing breakfast and so nice and incredibly helpful and keep smilling staff. I would really recomend it. We will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Small Rooms, Overall Good Value”
Reviews.Author: lazerduze
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at about 12 mins walk to the major attractions such as Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque, and no more than 5-6 mins walk to the Grand Bazaar. In my opinion, the location of this hotel is the selling point: it's about 2 mins walk away from Beyazit train station and is surrounded by local restaurants and even Burger King (not that we ate there when you have a wide array of Turkish cuisine at your disposal @ Divan Yolu). As for our standard room, it was practically a hole in the wall, but we really didn't care since we were out most of the day and night and didn't spend much time in the room. Included breakfast was stellar with all kinds of options--from fresh honeycomb to cereal to light turkish fare-Would rate it 4.5/5, and this is coming from a person who doesn't care for hotel meals (especially again, when you can eat out in Turkey). Rooftop views were amazing, but April was too cold for comfort, so we couldn't eat out or spend much time up there. Overall, I'd rate this hotel 4/5, primarily for the location. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, clean hotel, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Laura S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 309. Even though the elevator repairs went on from morning til night (they are adding 2 new elevators to the 3 already there), we never heard them from the room. The room had two twin beds in a small room, which did not leave a lot of room to store our suitcases. Good water pressure in the shower, American style toilets, and very clean washroom and room. Breakfast was boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, toast, pastries, fresh fruits, nuts, olives, tomatoes, processed sandwich meat, cheeses, french toast, Turkish tea, and sausages (that's the list of selections, we didn't actually eat all that for breakfast). The location is great--- only a 1-minute walk to the Grand Bazaar and busses/ tram. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull breakfast”
Reviews.Author: matilde47
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, the personal speaks Spanish and they are very kind. The hotel is situated near Cimberlitas , ten minutes from Santa Sofia Museum and 3 minutes from Great Bazar. The breakfast is perfect, not only for the meal....

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite definetly going back”
Reviews.Author: neha l
Reviews.Content: Love the Place. All the Attractions are in walking distance.The Hotel Staff are very helpful.I would strongly recomend for all my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for first trip to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Andrewcary11
Reviews.Content: Hotel has all the amenities you need, pretty good breakfast buffet. The location allows you to be in walking distance to many of the major spots, especially the Grand Bazaar. Also the tram is two blocks away, and that makes it easy to get to everyplace else. Staff is very friendly and accommodating, rooms are very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western the President”
Reviews.Author: l_manteiga
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Best Western President Hotel & had a wonderful stay.All staff very helpful.We would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Up on the roof”
Reviews.Author: dglambeth
Reviews.Content: Great location, very close to the Grand Bazaar and not far to walk (or a couple of tram stops) to many of the other major sights. Our selection criteria included a pool on the roof and free wifi. We got both and so, were happy, pretty much. All of the staff with whom we interacted were cheerful and helpful. Pool and sundeck are just whatâ€™s needed and we spent a lot of time there each day, making full use of the pool bar. Eating in the restaurant on the roof is good because the views are outstanding and the service is splendid. The foodâ€™s OK but only that. Breakfast was ample, with lots of choice, and with beautiful views of the Bosphorus as you eat. The was wifi throughout the building which is excellent for a geek like me. Unfortunately, the hotelâ€™s Netsafe programme doesnâ€™t let you look at a ludicrous list of unexpected things online: Istanbul restaurants, Frank Sinatra singing Come Fly With Me, anything on Flickr, articles on mythological beasts in ancient Turkish history, I could go onâ€¦ A farcical state of affairs. On my last morning, even The Guardian was â€œEngellendiâ€�. I could get onto Facebook and got my e-mails so I didnâ€™t get too irate. The room was good, with everything expected in it and well kept by the daily maid service. There was a complementary bottle of water provided every day and a variety of tea and coffee sachets for use with the kettle. Had read reviews mentioning the poor soundproofing and noise from the lift repairs but we werenâ€™t really troubled by it. All in all, we had a splendid time in this hotel and would be very happy to come back but probably not in the winter when the rooftop facilities are out of commission. Then youâ€™d have to rely on the â€œEnglish pubâ€� on the ground floor, which we never used, and you would be eating in the restaurant on ground level where I think they promised us belly-dancing etc.

Reviews.Title: “Really great hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: rcreswick1
Reviews.Content: This hotel was super -- close, very close to Grand Bazaar. Staff were more than helpful. Breakfast was great. Wonderful views from our rooms. Our grandson loved that it was close to McDonalds. The tram was a short walk. Instanbul is a truly great city with wonderful history, people and sights. We hope we will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: CollegeTraveler00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel and it was amazing! It is a two minute walk from the grand bazaar and the view from the rooftop is amazing! The lounge and pool area are on the roof and you can see all of Istanbul, the blue mosque, the mediterranean sea... Just amazing. The staff was helpful and i felt very safe. The hotel was completely clean and comfortable. Thank you for making my Istanbul trip amazing!

Reviews.Title: “We are impressed”
Reviews.Author: mmki
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel. Family friendly and child friendly. Very nice personal. They do all their best to make the tuirists satisfied. Very clean and comfortable beds. Quite room and very good sound isolation. When we visit Istanbul again we will choise this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient and pleasant”
Reviews.Author: Jambo_n9
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night for transit to Japan on the following day. The hotel is located at very convenient part of old city, close to Grand Bassar and good retaurants. I may stay everytime at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “i would never suggest it to any body !!!”
Reviews.Author: kewl98
Reviews.Content: we reserved 8 nights there through GTA, we checked in on 18th june and had to leave for bursa on 21st stay there for a night n then retun on 22nd, we left our luggage at the Best western istanbul, we reached there at 11 30 at night on 22nd just to get the news that our aALREADY PAID reservation had been cacelled n they requested our travel agent to book us somewhere else because they were offered more for the same room......despite the fact that we had three little kids and my mom and dad who are over 50 years were sitting there in the lobby tired and sleepy they insisted that we have to leave and they cannot even accomodate for the night so we could sort this out in the morning....did not even arrange for transportation....very rude!!!!this is what they do to their paid booked guests if they r offered more so DONT TRUST THEM

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place to Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: JohnW10255060
Reviews.Content: The Best Western President Hotel is really the best place to stay in Istanbul. It is well located and close to everything in the Old City. it is clean, comfortable and the rooms are well appointed. Rooms have tea and coffee service. They are quiet. The breakfast is great and the stadff are very helpful. As a bonus the hotel provides a large bottle of water daily to each room, so you don't have any hassles about finding water.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but some staff were rude and dismissive”
Reviews.Author: Reena27
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice - it is very clean, air conditioned, has a well equiped gym, very nice terrace. It is ideally located for all of the attractions in Istanbul - within walking distance for most of them. However, some of the staff were a little rude/dismissive especially to the female in the couple so for this reason we may not come back here again. The bar downstairs was a little dark and dingy and could have done with more natural light and you could only drink on one side of the terrace on the top floor, where there were not many tables, despite the fact that the restuarant was virtually empty on the other side, which we found a bit odd. For what they charge it is good but could be a lot better, as described above.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jinet7galin
Reviews.Content: In the heart of the city , very easy to go around the city Had all amenities that we expected, fitness & jacuzzi Fitness room is perfectly situated with the view of Ä°stanbul Great breakfast Good staff

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: Ortlinde
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel a number of times while visiting Istanbul. It is conveniently located near the Grand Bazaar and walking distance to the major sites of Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. The hotel recently upgraded its rooms and they are immaculate. The bedding consists of a white duvet -- so no more dirty bedspreads. It is a lovely oasis of cleanliness in a busy city. Staff at the front desk are very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was included in our rate and was very extensive. The buffet room waas located on the top floor and offered a lovely view of the sea and the many ships coming into port.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay...”
Reviews.Author: KSAR_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 7 nights and it was very nice. Every thing you need is around you, no need to take a taxi or worry about transportations. Staff were very nice and helpful, buffet was v.good and was managed properly. The only negative thing that we faced is the size of the room that they gave us, it was small and noisy and they couldn't manage to give us a bigger one. In all, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: naz632
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time. Central location, free internet access, clean room, very helpful staff, beautiful view for breakfast and dinner, delicious breakfast options. Thank you for a really wonderful stay. Look forward to visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “efficient staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: italyItalia
Reviews.Content: I have to say that this hotel isn't perfect and the rooms are quite little but my rating is for the staff because they managed to solve the problems I noticied very fast and with kindness. My first room was too noisy so I asked to move in another one and they managed it in few hours, then in the second room the air con wasn't working but they send immediatly a tecnician to fix it. The roof bar has an amazing view and the breakfast is rich. Tje location is very convenient so I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rose petals... E&J.”
Reviews.Author: E-Juan
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful... My husband had a wonderful birthday!! Very good location. I fell ill and the hotel staff helped my husband to get antibiotics... Excellent customer service.. Very good value for money.. Especially as the they still us the lire!!! I want to go back, NOW PLEASE!!!!!!!!!!!! I would go again for def. Strongly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fifth visit in 7 years which speaks for itself”
Reviews.Author: robertson27
Reviews.Content: Good location for exploring Istanbul. Friendly staff. Wonderful views from top floor restaurant and sundeck. Buffet breakfast of a high standard,even had a large honeycomb and a great variety to suit the tastes of all nationalities. Bedroom and en-suite fresh and clean. Transport from the Airport to the President excellent but the transport arranged by the Hotel for the return journey was late and we just made our flight ! wdr@logie.fsworld.co.uk

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Sooty077
Reviews.Content: Very convenient location - a block and a half from the Grand Bazaar and a tram stop straight to the Hagia Sophia and Blue Mosque (although you could easily walk it too). We stayed in the Presidential Suite which was very spacious, if a little tired. The staff were excellent, and made us feel very welcome. They were unbelievably kind to our two year old. The views of the Blue Mosque from the rooftop were amazing, as was the sunbaking on the sunbeds in the late afternoon. The breakfast was nice, and the restaurant on top lovely. Despite being next to a mosque, must have been sound proofed because we weren't woken by the noise with the windows closed. Couldn't have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “Definately recommend this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: MooshiPalmdale
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights for our family renuion and it was a perfect pick for our family! We used our AAA card to recieve discount. The location is perfect, close by to many of the main attractions. However when you ask how far places are, they always say 10 minutes and it is more like 30 minutes! However it is a very pleasant and safe walk to everywhere!! Their included breakfast was wonderful with European and Turkish foods. Loved their yogurt, cherries and honey for breakfast. Did not like their coffee at all!! Our room was typical European small rooms and we had an inside room, morning prayers only woke us up one time. The rooftop terrace with lovely sundeck was perfect to relax and watch the sunset with a cocktail after a day of sightseeing. We did use their rooftop pool to cool off several times. I did think their cocktails were overpriced but the view was outstanding of the Marmara Sea and the Blue Mosque. We did splurge one night with the family for their 2 for 1 dinner, the food was only ok but the views and ambience was amazing! I wanted to bring a bottle of wine to have with dinner and they said no even when I offered to pay a corkage fee. Desk staff were very nice and helpful especially Cansu who was so very helpful with directions. Included with our stay was free airport pick up and transportion to the hotel and they arranged transport back to the airport for 10 euros pp. They also had free computer use and we were able to print off our boarding passes. Our son used the gym and said it was good however I did want to use just the jazucci and they said there would be an extra charge so I said no thanks. Nice gift shop downstairs with comparable prices for Turkish souveniers. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again if we ever visit the lovely interesting city of Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “Mostly Positive Experience”
Reviews.Author: kohrbd
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights at the Best Western President Hotel in Istanbul during April and found it to be an excellent overall choice. It is very conveniently located near many of the city's attractions, restaurants, transportation (Bazaar, Mosques, Tram, etc.) and has most of the services that a traveler expects. It also has a more than adequate breakfast, reasonably clean rooms (if you discount the ants that seemed to find their way into the room every day) and very helpful staff. A very special bonus is that guests who stay at the hotel for 3+ days will be picked up at the airport at no charge--a great way to begin a visit to Istanbul. Unfortunately, there was one very bad incident that marked our stay at the hotel. We took a taxi from the hotel back to the airport. Prior to this, we had asked three separate hotel staff members what the taxi fare would be and were reassured when all three persons gave us the same answer. While loading our baggage into the taxi we again asked the same question of both the taxi driver and the hotel's bellhop on the street. This time the answer was "whatever is on the meter." Unfortunately, this cab's meter was on the floor of the taxi and out of sight of the passengers. The bill for the trip was fully 3X higher than that estimated by the hotel staff. As a consequence, I would recommend taking the crowded tram/metro to the airport or better, a hotel airport limo and not a cab from this hotel's line of taxis. Again, this was one very bad experience out of an overall wonderful visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent central hotel”
Reviews.Author: lindi3
Reviews.Content: We could not have been happier with this hotel. It is in easy walking distance to all the major sights, and almost on the doorstep of the Grand bazar. Rooms are super clean and have good facilities. Water is provided in a bottle each day. All the staff are super friendly and happy to help. Free wifi is available throughout the hotel. There's a fabulous terrace to relax on or sunbathe by the pool. There's also a restaurant on the terrace which serves good quality food and not over priced. The views across the city are fantastic. Drinks are expensive but this is true all over Istanbul. The hotel provide a free pick up service to and from the airport for anyone staying 3 nights or more and booking direct. Even if this does not apply, the car is only Â£25 each way and worth paying for for fast door to door travel, especially on arrival.

Reviews.Title: “I was enjoy to stay”
Reviews.Author: bertrand_delbart
Reviews.Content: Dear Tulay Akar It was a real pleasure to stay during 6 days in hotel Best western President Beyazit and in this beautiful Istanbul town. Nice sea view from the terrace restaurant - Grand bazar 200 m - easy Tramway - ( Sultanhamet at 2 stations ) Osmane ( Speak French ) and Mrs Tulay Akar are really efficient . I was enjoy to stay at this place. Bertrand.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel great staff”
Reviews.Author: colbyuk
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel and very convenient for the old part of the city ie, The Blue mosque and the Grand bazzar etc. The hotel staff were always very helpful, especially the two Customer Service girls Tulay and Cansu who went out of their way to organise anything that was requested. The breakfast was very good with plenty of variety but only of a continental variety, so don't expect bacon and eggs every morning. Having said that I found breakfast plentyful, of a good quality and always adequate. The roof top views and sun loungers on the sun terrace were really nice and not too crowded at this time of year. The swimming pool was nice but not big enough for serious swimmers, just okay to cool off from the summer sun. Prices in the bar are expensive, which is the same as anyone would find in a hotel of this rating. The rooms are an adequate size with very large double beds. The only downside I found was that the insulation between rooms was not very good, especially in the bathrooms. It seems as if there is a ceiling void that transfers sounds, as the walls seemed solid enough. Limited free WiFi access in the reception arae but free web access using the hotel business centre. Having said all that, I would recommend this hotel as a good base and would definately stop there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, recommended for short break”
Reviews.Author: LLMLondon
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, short walk to major tourist attractions. Comfortable rooms, good service. Lovely breakfast selection. Lovely roof terrace for relaxing after a hard day navigating the city. Short walk to Beyazit tram stop - use the tram, its cheap and easy!

Reviews.Title: “Central, friendly and good value”
Reviews.Author: Citybreakers844
Reviews.Content: Hotel arranged airport taxi transfers. Welcome on arrival was very efficient and friendly. We found the location more than satisfied our needs, being in the heart of main attractions. Our room was well appointed, with fridge, complimentary tea & coffee, safe. Bottled water was delivered daily. We took advantage of the 2 meals for the price of 1 on our first evening and found it really good value. All staff were extremely helpful and the room itself was spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location”
Reviews.Author: robertsue_harris
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very conveniently situated for visiting all the best sites in Istanbul. Near to the Beyazit tram stop and close to some excellent restaurants and the Grand Bazaar. You really get into the atmosphere of a vibrant city. Staff are very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls, poor internet receptin, 2-1/2 star at best”
Reviews.Author: jkhc1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nites in late April, 2011, prior to a land tour. Here are the pros and cons: A. Pro - good location, near the Grand Bazaar and walking distance to the Blue Mosque and St. Sophia. - provides free airport pickup if renting for 2 nites or more. B. Con - sound insulation very poor. I could hear every conversation next door. We had to whisper so as not to disturb our neighbours. - internet reception poor in the room. Had to go to the lobby everytime. - furnishings getting old. Time for complete refurbishing. - rooms are tiny. Closets every smaller. - hall way carpet needs cleaning. - outside restaurant information at reception not very helpful. There are may other hotel choices in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: travelling&goodfood
Reviews.Content: The Best Western President in Istanbul is in a great location, a few blocks away from the tram, a 5 minute walk to the Grand Bazaar, restaurants, shops and exchange centers, did not feel threatened walking to and from the hotel at any time. Wonderful, professional and gracious staff; a BIG THANK YOU to Tulay Akar at the front desk, she was extremely helpful and Burak Aydin who promptly answered each and every email. The hotel and rooms are spotless; complimentary pick up from the airport, a one day pass to the Health Club facility located on the 6th floor, delicious breakfast buffet also located on the on 6th floor with wonderful view. Complimentary bowl of fruit on arrival, kettle in room for tea and coffee and 1.5 liter bottle water daily as well a complimentary welcome cocktail at the English Pub. Would definitely stay here again, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: ThanosRubis
Reviews.Content: I have stayed to this hotel many times. It is a very nice hotel, very good service, comfortable rooms. Nice breakfast with great view. Secure indoor free parking. Heated Jacuzzi, small unheated pool. The area isnâ€™t very nice and during the night it is a little scary. But it is next to Covered Market and to the tram.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: schyndel
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel on a perfect location. The staff was very friendly, and professional. The room was vey comfortable and clean. Buffet breakfast was great and we appreciated the daily bottle fresh water. Everything we wanted to visit was within walking distance. The only flaw was internet access in our room. This was only possible for a couple of minutes with a phone or iPad. After logging in there was some kind of warning: do not close this page. So it seems that for using WiFi equipment with multitasking capabilities is required. Internet access in the business center was no problem. But all in all we strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel, great location tourist sites and public transport”
Reviews.Author: travel197
Reviews.Content: The efficient helpful response received from our email inquiry for accommodation, was a clear indication that this hotel was for us. Stayed at The President Hotel on two occasions in April as a base for travel to Gallipoli and beyond. Our arrivals were both during normal daylight hours and very late in the evening. On both occasions our check-in was easy with a minimum of fuss by the helpful hotel staff. Each room on the fourth floor, although not over large was well appointed providing a remarkable level of cleanliness. Bathrooms were spotless. The complimentary bowl of fruit on arrival, tea coffee making facilities and bottle water daily was a bonus. During our stay, our room provided good sleep quality, sometimes interrupted by the plumbing operations. Throughout the hotel, staff provided a very high standard of service and it was obvious they were available to meet the guests needs. When considering service to hotel guests, Tulay Akar/Guest Relations must rate a mention for her wonderful efficient ability to ensure any advice/help needed about hotel issues or where to shop, eat or the printing of airline boarding pass's was always available. The daily breakfast is excellent, providing a full range of foods to meet the needs of guest. Located on the 6th floor provides wonderful views of the city and waterways and just a great place to begin the daily holiday. The hotel is located in the old city, in a quiet street very close to many tourist sites. About 300 metres to the Grand Bazaar and public transport (tram) enabling easy travel to other sites and other parts of Istanbul. We travel and use Best Western often. The President Hotel and staff exceeded our expectation and we would stay there again. The complimentary taxi to airport (min 3 night stay) was certainly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated”
Reviews.Author: clair_watts
Reviews.Content: Clean well serviced room, good range of tv channels, internet provided for free, fast room service, excellent location (walking distance to sights yet not in amongst the general noise & choas), friendly & helpful staff ....only downside that I found was that the soundproofing between rooms was very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to the Grand Bazaar”
Reviews.Author: mtbsafari
Reviews.Content: Again, this hotel was chosen for us, as part of a package tour. We would probably not have chosen it, as we usually go for 5*, and there are some great hotels in Istanbul. Best bits - location in the old town within easy walking distance of the main attractions and restaurants, breakfast and views from the dining room Worst bits - small sized rooms, pricey minbar, dodgy wi-fi login for Mac users Apparently a 4*. Would say that is being extremely generous. Worst bits - small sized rooms,

Reviews.Title: “comfortable hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Barrysu
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel- very comfortable location is excellent- can walk throughout the old city hotel's facilities are very good beautiful dining area and terrace staff were very friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay and discover Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: dutchguitarman
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, perfect location. The hotel was renewed to the latest comfort level. The first night we had to stay in a suite, perfect. Although the standards room were good too. Fresh drinking water in the room every day, some fruit also. The breakfast restaurant was on top , nice view , good food. Friendly staff, helpful. We had a good stay and will go to this hotel again in the future. The location is perfect in the old city, sightseeing can be done by foot, like the bazar, aya sophia, basilik cisterne, topkapi. And to go to the new city, just take the tram, it stops on the corner and brings you to a lot of interesting places .

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionnal”
Reviews.Author: ducajoi
Reviews.Content: We can strongly recommend the Best Western President in Istanbul for the following reasons: - The location, right in the middle of the historical center of Istanbul allows you to access by feet within a few monutes to the main places; - The comfort is excellent. Most of the rooms have been recently renovated. - The buffet breakfast on the top floor is wonderful with a beautiful view on the Marmara Sea. - Last but not least, the efficiency and the kindness of the staff is exceptionnal. We have been there each year for more than 10 years and we feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Brinks_Denmark
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to its good reviews and excellent position almost in the centre of the old town.. Everywhere we wanted to visit was within a few minutes walk and for our needs this hotel certainly seemed to be the best placed of any in Istanbul. We stayed for seven nights so the hotel offered a free pick up from and to the airport. It worked great, and at the arrival at the hotel, the check-in was done in 3 minutes, and we in our room 2 min later. Free WIFI in rooms, Fantastic breakfast on top floor with great views over town and sea, and the staff is all wery helpfull, and always ready to give good answers. The fitness Club were ok equipped. Hanne & Erik Brinks Denmark

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel -- i highly recommend it!”
Reviews.Author: snowcampandrea
Reviews.Content: President Hotel is an exceptional value at a prime location, mere blocks from the Grand Bazaar, the waterfront, historic sites, and lots of shopping. Rooms are well equipped, staff are exceedingly friendly and helpful. i highly recomment the President Hotel, and will certainly be staying there during future trips to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommend”
Reviews.Author: Awwe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights had 2 rooms. The rooms were ok but very small. The hotel staff was quite useless. We had reserved 2 rooms and they were not even next to each other! When I asked if we could change the guy gave me am excuse about not having rooms. Whatever happened to making advance reservations under the same name! Here is why I would NOT stay here again.. They had a party on the 6th floor 2 out of the 4 nights and the music was so loud that you could not sleep! I was on the fourth floor and I could hear the music loud and clear. It seems like the hotel staff do not care about their room guests. Apart from this the location is just ok. It is not on the main street and food options are limited apart from the expensive restaurants in the hotel. The only good thing was their hotel room supplies and large breakfast with a great water view. If you actually want to get some rest in your room like most tourists that come back tired after a long day...may be you should look somewhere else to stay!

Reviews.Title: “historical experience”
Reviews.Author: DohaMax
Reviews.Content: hotel was close to the historic locations and tram station. buffet breakfast was nice but it was same. internet access was a pain... everytime, i logged in and accessed a page... i had to enter the user id , password again after logging out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, professional service, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: tiklaima
Reviews.Content: Good choice if you want to visit the tourist attractions. Everything is within walking distance. Service very professional, rooms a bit small, but clean and decent. Some have a nice view on the sea. Nice panorama from the breakfast restaurant. Reasonable price

Reviews.Title: “Extra time in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: brmen
Reviews.Content: This was the first hotel I stayed in, after arriving in Turkey. Looking back, it was the most comfortable hotel that I stayed in during my two weeks in Istanbul. The room size was reasonable..., but it had amenities that few other hotels in Turkey offer, such as alarm clocks, comfortable beds/bedding, etc. The breakfast buffet was great. The hotel is centrally located in Istabul. It is close to the major tourist attractions and transport hubs. The hotel also has a breathtaking view of the Marmara Sea. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIFIC VALUE AND RELAXING”
Reviews.Author: ckpsy401
Reviews.Content: This was a find-comfortable, friendly english-speaking staff, great breakfast ( i think the turks make better bread than french ) , lovely pool. only hitch was repair work being done that made my room inhabitable one afternoon but they were understanding and gave me empty suite to relax in and i returned to giant fruit basket and chocolates. Rooms large and had refrig, not just mini-bar. Two negatives: fitness room had strange hours (evening only ) and internet connection, while free was intermittent so if you have heavy duty work to do.... The business center no help, in fact ,worse. Location for site seeing was terrific-could see Blue Mosque from room easily and river too. Terrific roof top views when weather clear. The concierge was a doll and never missed with advice. Be warned that streets are steep and narrow in this section of town .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great breakfast with magical views”
Reviews.Author: sheryl02
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the old town of Istanbul. Close to Grand Bazar and easy walk to Blue Mosque and other tourist attractions. Free WIFI in rooms, Fantastic breakfast on top floor with great views over town and sea. tea/coffee making facilities in room and so easy to get to from airport on the Metro and tramline Definately would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service, excellent position”
Reviews.Author: Gadabouts95
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to its good reviews and excellent position. Everywhere we wanted to visit was within a few minutes walk and for our needs this hotel certainly seemed to be the best placed of any in Istanbul. We stayed four nights so the hotel offered a free pick upfrom the hotel, which worked very well. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary during our stay and were greeted on arrival by Tulay Akar of guest relations. On our anniversary we were given a basket of fruit, bottle of wine and and a hand written card from Tulay. All the staff were really friendly and helpful but we would like to single out Tulay in particular. Rooms were comfortable and clean. We had paid for a sea view room and ours was more than adequate, although some rooms are on the small size. Breakfast was in a large room on the 6th floor with panoramic views over the city. The buffet table ran the length of the room with a wide selection of things to choose from. Our one complaint is that the walls of the rooms are rather thin (a common problem with Istanbul hotels it would seem). On our first night our sleep was disrupted by a neighbour speaking on skype to his family for two hours at the top of his voice. The next night it was a different guest and we had to ask him to turn down the sound on his TV. Even allowing for thin walls it was extremely loud. The best was yet to come! A British guest who decided to hold a very long and loud telephone conversation at 2am. We complained to guest services and he finished his call only for the phone to ring 10 minutes later. We complained to guest services again who sent someone to his room. After a brief argument things went quiet and we finally got to sleep. I'm not sure whether this is a regular occurence or we were just very unlucky but Istanbul does seem to attract some very thoughtless hotel guests in our experience. In spite of this we would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and look forward to returning in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: encinitassusan
Reviews.Content: stayed at this wonderful hotel for 10 days. everything was clean. my room was at the end of the hall, 4th floor, quiet, with a nice view out the side of the window (which opened for fresh air) breakfast was very good especially whe i figured out they would make eggs any way you wanted. went on an early morning flight with a group and the hotel had breakfast ready for us at 5:45a.m.. room was very clean, white duvet, nice bath products. even robes and slippers were provided. i thought it was in a great neighborhood for walking. 5 minutes to grand bazaar. close to public transportation. concierge very helpfgul when i needed to make a call to british air regarding my flight. would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Top location for visiting bazaar and all sights! Almost everything in walking distance!”
Reviews.Author: mariplus1964
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in two double rooms. The kids' room was slightly bigger than ours and had two single beds. Our room was more on the small side and a little but darker as it was a corner room. But with a double bed it was okay and we spent most time sightseeing anyway so that did not annoy us. What's absolutely striking is the location. Within five minutes You arrive at the Great Bazaar. It takes only a little bit more time to get to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, the Cisterne and the Suleyman Mosque. Also the Spice Bazaar is easy to reach. Although we just arrived during a cold spell with snow and wind we spent most of our time walking through Istanbul. The roof terrace is wonderful in good weather. The pool is just for having fun. We did not visit the fitness center - no interest after days spent walking!!! Also we left out the beauty area, so no comment on that one. Breakfast at the Marmara Room is nice and well equipped with boiled and scrambled eggs, fruit, tomatoes, turkish sweets and bread and jam as well as toast and muesli and some more cereals. You have a good view around the area and the sea gulls do their best to entertain you. We enjoyed our time at the pub where you get snacks or restaurant food. The restaurant offers a regional four course meal which we did not have, but the other dishes are fine, too. Next time we go we'll stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel to stay in Istanbul!!!”
Reviews.Author: MysOia
Reviews.Content: We just returned today from our trip to Istanbul. What an amazing hotel to stay in! The property is immaculately clean. The rooms are warm and cozy. The location is the best you can choose, only 2 minutes walk from the Grand Bazaar and 10 minutes walk from Agia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Top Kapi and Spice Bazaar. The service is absolutely spotless. Everyone from the Reception and Concierge to the Waiters and the Housekeeping are most helpful and friendly. I have never seen, in all hotels I have been, such an attentive and fast service at breakfast.... and believe me, they are busy!!! I will tell you this, Istanbul, is not just for one visit. If you go once, you will definately go again and again, and this is the place to stay. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul's best kept secret”
Reviews.Author: rcey
Reviews.Content: Just have to add our thanks and compliments to the team at The President and in particular to Ms Tulay Akar for exceptional service. We simply could not fault the hotel and were honestly sad to leave. Value for money, a sincere welcome and just a wonderful feeling of being a welcome guest all add up to make this a very special hotel. We celebrated my husbands birthday and were very touched when he was presented with a birthday cake - now that's special ! Its very close to pretty much all that you want to see in Istanbul and the local restaurants are within a very comfortable easy walk - a real gem!

Reviews.Title: “Had a lovely stay wid great facilites”
Reviews.Author: rucha_thakor
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to celebrate my 1st wedding anniversary in turkey so this hotel was recommended by Thomas Cook..And i really enjoyed my stay over there... Amazing facilities, lovely break fast, nice interior, quick customer services and lovely location of marmara room and terrace. I wish i could extend our stay over there.. And the hotel is near to all attractions,grand bazar, marmara beach and tram station so i would like to recommend this hotel who wish to travel by tram aur taxi. Someone said that '' 1st impression is last impression ''.There was warm welcome from staff at all times. As it was our anniversary, the manager gave us best wishes card, decorative fruit basket and wine as surprise gift and free fruit cocktail at engliish pub of hotel. Also i would like to add :- we enoyed great facility of jacuzi, pool and fitness centre. Had lovely fruit cocktail in english pub of hotel. And had such a memorable dinner in orient house of hotel...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Experience -- Best in a long time!”
Reviews.Author: maxSchaumburg
Reviews.Content: The entire exprience (8 days) was great. The hotel staff could not have been more accommodating and helpful. They opened up the buffet breakfast for myself and friends at 4:30 a.m., so we could have breakfast before departing for an all day adventure to Capoddocia. The hotel provides free internet service, free exchange of money. The location is within walking distance to all important venues ie, Blue Mosque, Spice Market, Grand Bazaar, Haga Sophia etc. The Best Western President would be my first choice when traveling to Instanbul again and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Extraordinary Guest Services, Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelingtutor
Reviews.Content: From the moment I arrived on New Year's Eve at the Best Western President, the experience was positive. I was efficiently checked in, and provided with two tickets for the New Year dinner and show. I did not ask for this, nor was I charged for the tickets, I was merely invited to join in the festivities. I was also greeted by a lovely and helpful guest services representative named Tulay Akar. She was most helpful in helping me plan my excursions and answering any questions I had about Istanbul's sights and culture. The room was clean and pleasant, with a sizeable, modern bath, including a full tub and shower. I also had a beautiful view of the sea from my room, not to mention the stunning, panoramic view from the rooftop terrace and breakfast area. The daily breakfast was high quality, and had plenty of selections to meet nearly anyone's dietary needs. I was particularly fond of the yogurt, fruit, and cheeses, in addition to the fresh juices and strong tea. The hotel is ideally located within walking distance to the historic attractions and public transportation. The Best Western President and its staff definitely played a large part of an enriching experience in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: smurray2006
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was excellent for sightseeing. Right near a tram stop. You could walk or tram to the main sights. The lobby area was very nice. The breakfast buffet was fantastic. They also have an excellent gym, pool, and spa. Checkin was slightly quirky, but the personnel were very nice. The problem was that they had my reservation but no evidence of my full in-advance payment and wanted me to (re)pay. Luckily I had a print out of the reservation AND payment, otherwise I'm not sure what would have happened. Cons: my room was very small. It was also fairly noisy in that you could hear lots of sounds from within the hotel in the room (like the elevators, hotel room doors closing, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, lovely stff, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Carolinde
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Istanbul; I stayed at The President Hotel for four nights and really enjoyed it. At this hotel they really make guests very comfortable; they really know the meaning of the word "hospitality". The room was a good size, it was clean, the bed was good, there were plenty of TV channels. Good breakfast, plenty of choice. The hotel is in a good location: Aya Sofia, The Grand Bazaar, the Blue Mosque and Topkapi Palace were all within 10 minutes walking distance. Every day there was a free bottle of mineral water in my hotel room, which was nice, because it saves you time having to go to a shop and get it yourself. Use of the Internet was free. There were nice restaurants in this area, but also in the hotel itself. There was a nice English pub and a restaurant next to it, where I had dinner one night, which was excellent. There is also a good coffeeshop. The staff at this hotel were very helpful, quick to help you book a tour or call a cab. Also nice waiters and cleaning ladies! (These people are so easily forgotten!). In all I think The President Hotel have a very good team! So.......compliments to everyone working there! Next time I am in Istanbul I will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with super location near the Grand Bazar”
Reviews.Author: andone_bsl
Reviews.Content: We had a really nice stay in Istanbul in this hotel. The room was ok, the walls are not very thick, but as ther were not many guests this was no problem. We enjoyed the big breakfast-buffet and the nice view over the city and also had some drinks at the english pub. We once used the hotel-restaurant " the terasse". The food was good and the price ok because one menu was free. the only negative thing to say is that wehn we checked out, we asked the the staff to get us a taxi and they did, but the driver was very rude and although the taximeter showed 10 TL at the end, he just switched it off and wanted us to pay 28 TL!!! we feared he would drive away with our bagage so we payd him 25 TL. I would advise to call your own cab as we saw some reviews ant it seems this has happened before...

Reviews.Title: “Best stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: jukka011
Reviews.Content: I have use The President Hotel since 1994 during my several trips to Istanbul. Location is great for shopping and business. Hotel is in heard of the city but it took only around 20 minutes to airport by taxi. Great sightseeings, like Grand Bazaar and old Sultanahmet area with it's Mosques are nearby within couple minutes walking distance. Hotel rooms are recently renowated, comfortable and cozy. Hotel staff is helpfull and make me always feel like home. Service is fast and prompt. During my many stays in hotel i have never face a single problem. I'm using hotels all over the world more or less 200 nights in year. The President Hotel is one of the best. I highly recommend The President Hotel for business travellers and tourists visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: munsterforever
Reviews.Content: I would not even bother checking out another Hotel in istanbul when I return as this Hotel has everything anybody could need. The attention to detail in everything they have done here is apparent for all to see.This really is the perfect Hotel. I loved the Breakfast, the rooftop areas, the gym, the pool and the room.
