My Daughter loved the pull out bed! However the best thing about this Hotel are the Staff, they are the kindest and most generous people I have had the fortune to meet. From the Waitresses at Breakfast to the lovely Lady in the CafÃ© near reception and the chef in the restaurant.. however a special mention to the Manager who wouldnt let me pay for some Ice Cream for my Daughter, and Tulay who is the most helpful, sincere and gentle person I have yet met in a Hotel. This was my first visit to Istanbul and Turkey and the excellent Hotel and its staff made me question why I had not visited before. I left with a positive perception of Istanbul and the Turkish people and will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best value of money in Istanbul : location, price, services and employees.”
Reviews.Author: alobaidialh
Reviews.Content: I recommend the management to treat the lonely disadvantage : wall sound insulation, Eng Hussein Alobaidi , Jordan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JohnW10255060
Reviews.Content: The Best Western President Hotel is in a great location in Istanbul, close to the Grand Bazaar and the Beyazit tram stop. The hotel itself is modern and well furnished. The rooms are comfortable and well equipped. The bathrooms are first class. The hotel has a complimentary tea and coffee service and also provides a free 1.5 litre bottle of water each day. The staff are friendly and attentive. It is great value for money. Breakfasts are a feast. The restaurant and the English style pub offer good quality meals. I have stayed here on 4 occasions and I would never stay at another hotel in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Five friends from Sweden”
Reviews.Author: nisse012
Reviews.Content: We are five ladies from Sweden, we travel a lot together and visit different citys but Istanbul has become our favoritcity and Best Western President Hotel our favorithotel. We vere very well treated from the day we arrived until the day we left. The staff at the hotel were very professional, friendly and had a very nice approach. The hotel was clean and the rooms were very comfortable. The roof with the restaurant and the wiew were amazing. The location was perfect, so close to everything. I`m going to bring my husband when I return to this city and this hotel. We all five ladies recommend this hotel for many reasons but mostly because the fantastic staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: palmykop
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the Hotel before and the location is ideal with the usual excellent service from the Hotel staff. Has a very nice "English Pub" style bar and the rooms are very clean and comfortable. The breakfasts were very good with an excellent situation looking over the City. Staff were always attentive and the "booking in" and "booking out" was very efficient and friendly. All staff spoke very good English and were very helpful.The "Grand Bazaar" is less than a block away and is very close to the tram system which is fast and convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Couple from Finland will tank the BW President hotel staff!”
Reviews.Author: Finland2010
Reviews.Content: We had 5 days holiday in the BW President hotel. We had an allercig room with wooden floor & partial sea view (room number 426)! The staff of the hotel were very helpful. Breakfast at the upper floor was great. You can see the sunset and blue moskey from the upper floor (6th floor) terasse. Grand bazaar is located very near. Blue mosque, Hagia Sofia, Topkapi, Hippodrome & Basilica cistern are in the walking distance. Also the tram station is very near and the price is very, very cheap. We visited at Dolmabahce palace (worth to see!) with the tram. Also, the Oriental show in the Orient House (next to the hotel!) is worth to see, especially all the belly dancers are excellent dancers! We enjoyed of our stay in BW President hotel very much! We'll recommend this hotel to our frends!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ms1106
Reviews.Content: Had a very good holiday at this hotel. Everything went well. Room comfortable. Staff very helpful and courteous. Breakfast good. One small issue. The free wifi needs attention. it was not possible to stay logged on for more than one minute on my phone. A fault the hotel is aware of. Highly recommended as a very well located hotel. We loved Istanbul too. Friendly people.

Reviews.Title: “Well located and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: oxforduser
Reviews.Content: Down a side street off the main road the hotel offers a quieter location while still being within 10 minutes from the main sites (less if you use trams which stop nearby). Reasonable quality 'international' decor and reasonable service. I'd booked a 'superior' room with 'sea view'. OK, the sea is a good 500 metres away but I got a very comfortable room with a spacious private terrace and really nice views over the roof tops to the sea of Marmara. Room was good size, bathroom good, and the air conditioning did its job. Decor slightly faded but quite acceptable. Hotel provided a free 1.5 litre bottle of mineral water each day in the room - which is good given that drinking the tap water isn't recommended. Breakfast was extensive buffet style with a very Turkish theme, but service slightly shambolic. Coffee came out of a machine and was really poor. Wouldn't recommend the restaurant or coffee bar for meals or snacks - they were ok but really nothing special and not good value. Overall, this is a good choice if it's your first trip to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Best Western Scrimp on Air Conditioning Again”
Reviews.Author: Bengy1944
Reviews.Content: Hotel and Staff excellent especially customer services who could not do enough to make our stay more enjoyable,BUT the air conditioning or lack of the facility let our Istanbul experience down, we appreciate Summer is possibly over in October but ,we could not sleep in 25 / 28 degrees and although our room was changed to an outside facing room so that we could maybe get a breeze, the street noise kept us awake.The staff made all the explanations as to why and when the air con would work, which no doubt they are duly instructed to do, but having stayed in Spain after the season and experienced exactly the same problem now realize this is probably company policy within the Best Western Chain . The air con is controllable in each room so surely, it is better for guest comfort to have the air-con available if required than not at all.This would definitely be a decider in choosing to stay at a Best Western again, sleep deprivation whilst on holiday is not necessary. and I can see by other reviews this is a problem reported before so please Best Western take note.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for accommodation and location”
Reviews.Author: Sue503883
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 night stay with husband and friends. Very nice hotel, breakfast excellent and with great view as breakfast room on 6th floor. Restaurant in hotel very good. English pub very dark and needs a bit of update. Beds a bit hard but will suppply a mattress topper if you ask (we didn't realise this until we were leaving). Pillows also not very comfortable. Husband didn't mind as he sleeps well. Would stay again as very friendly with good service. Very close to grand Bazzar and easy walk to Blue Mosque, Haghia Sophia & Topkapi Palace.Tram stop a couple of minutes away, 1.50TL per trip - tokens from machine by stops and change given, very efficient and clean (very full most of time). many restaurants within 10-15 minutres walk. Cafes rarely sell alcohol and is quite expensive in the restaurants everywhere. A clean city without litter but I found the cats and dogs wandering the city very upsetting, the cats are quite friendly and the dogs which seem to be quite large look very sad. Very few people out walking with dogs on leads as normally seen in cities. Otherwise a good hotel situated well for sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised with Best Western President Hotel with excellent location in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: VDMBoise
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a pleasant surprise right in the middle of Istanbul. It was very conveniently located for all the sights and things to do with never more than a 10 minute walk. There was a mix-up on the reservations and the staff bent over backwards to accomodate us. The hotel was beautiful, the rooms were normal size and clean and the staff surprised us with a complimentary bottle of water and fruit basket. This hotel is a gem and I can highly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated for "One night in Istanbul"”
Reviews.Author: BjorSto
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely perfect for our short visit to Istanbul. Everything was within walking distance. Arriving at Istanbul Ataturk Airport, the Metro and tram brought us smoothly to the city centre and with only 100 meters left to reach the hotel. At the front desk we were met by a friendly staff who did give us all the help we needed for a successful stay. A complementary refreshment was served in the English Pub and we had a nice cup of tea in the sun lounge. With only on night available, we could reach the Bazar, the Blue Mosk and Hagia Sofia by foot and after that a folklore show with dinner in a nearby restaurant. The room was excellent and quiet with a nice view. This hotel would be my choice also the next time I will visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, very clean hotel with friendly, knowledgable and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: pdb1976
Reviews.Content: Great Location, very clean hotel with friendly, knowledgable and helpful staff. This is right near the Grand Bazaar and within walking distance for all the major sights in the Old City. The breakfast was very good and had a view that overlooks the city. The staff was unbelievably helpful and knowledgable about the city and any requests we made. For the money, a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: bensonhurst1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel at 11:30 pm and were greeted by very nice people at the front desk. We were shown to our room right away and it was a junior suite. It was a beautiful room, extremely clean and fresh looking. In the morning we ate at the buffet. There were many people and alot of choices. Very nice set up. We were very pleased with our stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the Grand Bazaar”
Reviews.Author: onthegoWirral
Reviews.Content: The President Hotel is in the old city of Istanbul. Really close to the Grand Bazaar and not that far from the sights of The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and if you walk down the hill, it is very steep and is cobbled you get to the Kennedy Cadesi which is the road which goes round the Sea of Marmaris and towards the Bosphurus. The view from the Resturant is excellent & going one floor up again to the infinity pool area & stepping out to the sun lounge areas you look across an amazing view of roof tops, sea & land on Asian side of Istanbul. The hotel staff are very polite and helpful, the gift shop is well worth a visit. The wi-fi is free & you are given a link to log onto which worked perfectly. There is an English Pub & Oriental Resturant attached to this hote, we though went out and about to the local resturants. The breakfasts were really good lots of choice & the chefs were always around making sure that everything was topped up & fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GHA
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel at the end of August. Our room was clean, quiet and comfortable. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast was excellent. The hotel is centrally located a short walk to the main street which leads to most of the main attractions. You can then walk to the attractions or take the tram. Entrance to Grand Bazaar 300 metres approx from hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel, ideal location in the heart of the old town”
Reviews.Author: Robert188113
Reviews.Content: perfect hotel within short walking distance to the grand bazar (1min) Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque (5-10 min). Very clean and comfortable rooms. Great view from the roof top terrace/terrace restaurant overlooking old istanbul, the Blue mosque and the Boshperus. Service very good and gentle. Pool smal but very nice - Terrace Hotel very nice - service and food very good quality.

Reviews.Title: “The pleasant hotelsuper with kind from restaurant to Bosporus”
Reviews.Author: victorz10
Reviews.Content: The pleasant hotel to be in the historical center, near to sights.Nearby a stop of a high-speed tram. Good breakfasts, a wide choice of dishes and a super kind from restaurant to Bosporus. A magnificent terrace. Truth very bad noise isolation of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, good service and most helpfull”
Reviews.Author: rich077
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased with the quality and location of the hotel, it was within 10 minutes walk of many of the main locations. The staff were very helpful and it is worth asking them for information such as likely taxi fares in advance to avoid any problems. Very clean rooms, nice indoor pool/ sunbathing area with great views The Orient House show held in the next building to the hotel is also very good with a good meal and good standard of entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “A clean and well managed hotel with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: willgaski
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well situated and within easy walking distance of most of the main tourist attractions. It is better and quicker to walk rather than using a taxi mainly because of the traffic and congestion around the side streets. Take a difffent walking route from and to the hotel to enable you to take in the wonderful Istanbul atmosphere and character in the side streets. This was our first visit and it was amazing. Water is bottle only; there is a little shop 50 mts from the hotel where I bought extra supplies at 1lr for a large bottle. If you are taking home Turkish delight and souveniers buy them at the bazzar they are half the price than at the airport. Beware of prices quoted in Euros rather than Liras. Keep an eye on paper money - when I went to change my Liras at the Post Office they scrutinised the notes and said that if they were of a certain date or the wrong colour they would not accept them so its worth checking the rules when you buy your currency.

Reviews.Title: “well locate”
Reviews.Author: LLC88
Reviews.Content: big hotel, a little bit old but very good locate also good price, good breakfast.Also very near to most of the turistic area, even seafood restaurants. a amaizing view of the city on the top of the buiding, nices place to have a dinner. really small swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in all respects except they charge for health club”
Reviews.Author: satish2000
Reviews.Content: wi fi facilty is greatly appreciated during the entire period of stay

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: rvgg
Reviews.Content: We were quite surprised at the helpfulness and care shown by the front desk and the other hotel staff. the room was always kept neat and orderly, the hotel is environmentally friendly by promoting segregation of waste, proper use of linens and maintained cleanliness at all times. i will always promote this hotel for istanbul for its good location, friendly staff and of course for its neat and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant and would definately use again.”
Reviews.Author: Prettyjen
Reviews.Content: Positive: Location was brilliant for the price, a little bit noisy if you has the window open at night and went to bed before the street hawkers. Easy to walk everywhere and just off the main road in Sultanahmet. Very clean hotel and very professional staff. Breakfast buffet was good. Really nice hotel to come back to after a hard and hot mornings sightseeing. The pool was just big enough for a dip and the roof terrace with sun loungers was great. I would definately use this again and recommend.Room was nice with very good bed, slippers and bathrobes and you get 1.5 litres of bottled water per day for free. Negative: Only downside was we didn't realise that this meant specifically the large bottle of water and took some small ones from the fridge, only to be charge at the end even though we hadn't used the daily allocatin- seemed a bit petty. Also, the front desk staff were a bit abrupt at times. Otherwise a really good clean and well run hotel with a good mixture of customers from all over the world.

Reviews.Title: “very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: samina55
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite for us and our 8 year old son. We expected our son to be in the same room as us but sleeping on a sofa bed, but to our surprise he had his own room and entrance via patio doors to balcony. Our room was only one 2 rooms in the whole hotel that had balconies. Rooms were clean and spacious with TV on both sides. The hotel is 5 minutes from the grand bazaar, and walking distance from Blue mosque, and agia sophia. Staff friendly and approachable and speak english which helps. Swimming pool is only 1.4 m deep all round so just right I think. There is also a small mini pool only 0.5 m deep for children and our son lived in it!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: David_Kay
Reviews.Content: We stayed in for 3 nights, as part of a 2 centre holiday, for some culture and shopping before returning home. The hotel is off the main street/tram route, about 200m south of the Grand Bazzar, so is very convenient for tourist attractions in the Old City. The standard rooms are reasonably spacious and comfortable, while the roof terrace and small indoor pool are nice for relaxing after a full days sight-seeing. We only used the retaurant for breakfast, as there are so many good places nearby to eat out, and this was an adequate self-service affair. On the ground floor, the reception area is a bit pokey, with space rather compromised by a cafeteria and the attached "English Pub", which was OK for watching the World Cup final on big screen TV but otherwise to be avoided.

Reviews.Title: “Steps from Grand Bazzar, fantastic junior suites”
Reviews.Author: EyeDocBrazil
Reviews.Content: The President is located no more than 100 meters from the Grand Bazzar, probably the liveliest place in IST. The reception is not plushy but reception people are very fast and polite in check in and out. Hotel staff definitely tries to please all guests needs. It is a medium size hotel with some 200 rooms,6 floors, and swimming pool (unfortunately not heated), plus a spa and small gym. Free internet in a good speed Great breakfast selection, in a beautiful place. I managed to upgrade to a Junior suite( I believe they have 8 of these), that offered a very spacious area and a fantastic veranda with the most stunning view of IST. I've added some pictures , so try to stay in one of the suites, as they present a fantastic cost -beneffit. Other rooms are also very clean and clear; good pillows and mattress. Do not exchange money at Airport, close to hotel you'll get honest rates. Great fishmarket restaurant just for locals leaving hotel to left, 3 blocks down- really worth pay a visit. So I strongly suggest you to stay there, but , one very serious advise: do not eat in the Terrace Restaurant of the hotel - better just go there to enjoy the fantastic view - but scape from their poor almost unhealthy food.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Good Services.”
Reviews.Author: snowmax2002
Reviews.Content: My friend introduced us to stay at Best Western the President Hotel. We just love it. The hotel has great location. It's so convenient to visit the city, and still be able to go back hotel and take a short break. The hotel is clean, room is big enough, free Wi-Fi (can't beat that), staff are super nice. We will definitely recommend friends and other family members to stay at this hotel if they visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “INCREDIBLE,FANTASTIC STAY!!”
Reviews.Author: muyo7
Reviews.Content: when you are in ISTANBUL this is the hotel that you MUST stay!! very central close to sultanahmet and every think you want to see as a leiser or business traveler... ROOMS, very comfortable,good size...,beds to die for!! VERY CLEAN, internet,good stocked mini bar,and the bosphorus wiev from most of the rooms...even is in the central of istanbul night time it is very quiet and you can have a good night sleep!!! bothroms with shower againe very modern and good size and very very clean you even have bothrops!! there is a swiminpool top of the roof with bosphorus wiev and the restourant(VERY GOOD FOOD) server with very professianal staff even LIVE MUSIC day and night!!!!! house keeping INCREDIBLE!! i think what makes this hotel sooo special is the people who works there!!! they would do anythink for you with alot of passion!! even i was there for short stay but it was wonderfull experience!! my boss AHMET CANDARLI would like to thanks ERCAN from reception who was very professianal,very helpful, good mannered who knew his job so well!!!! while i was leaving the hotel door man (i cant remember his name) big gay with good heart and plus he was loving his job so much that you can suddenly tell.....asked me if i wanted a taxi and taxi was there in a second......what a wonderfull door man!!! i can't wait to stay there again as we come to istanbul very offen for buissnes please give a chance to this four star hotel BUT you will receiveFIVE star COMFORTand SERVICE!!!!!!!! WHAT A WONDERFULL EXPERIENCE...................

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, clean hotel and good location in old city”
Reviews.Author: Cipeks
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the President for 4 nights. The hotel is 30 min away from Ataturk airport and 2 in away from the tram stop "Beyazit". The hotel staff are very helpful and recommended nice restaurants.If one wants to stay in the old city, I would highly recommend the President. Rooms are very well kept. Public computers with free internet connection available. Decent breakfast included turkish pastries,yogurt, bread, eggs, cereal and fruits. Make sure that taxi drivers/ transfers at the airport don't mislead you into believing that the hotel is 1hr away from the airport when it is only 30 min away from Ataturk Intl airport.

Reviews.Title: “Super Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kvkvkv
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the President Hotel for one night. The best service and location. Can recommend this hotel for all kinds of stay; family or business.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PAOLA_ROMA_2010
Reviews.Content: We liked very much this hotel. Very good situation to visit old city in Istanbul. We was in this hotel because a friends of us were the year before and they liked very much too. Good relation quality/price. Staff very kind and comfortable. Good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable”
Reviews.Author: roscol32
Reviews.Content: From the time I booked this hotel, the followup has been tremendious. In all my years of travel, I have never received a welcome message from a hotel before I even arrived (outstanding!). The service starting from the airport pick-up, to the doorman, reception, housekeeping, restaurent staff, not to mention the outstanding hospitality desk, left nothing to be desired. This the first time I have ever written a hotel review, and believe me, I have stayed at a lot of hotels..

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: BCWSanJose
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled extensively over the years, we were very impressed during our 5 night stay at the BW President Hotel 6/5/10-6/10/10. The hotel is located within walking distance to most of the important sites in Old Town Istanbul, the service was excellent, food was very good, room was clean. For a moderately priced hotel it was one of the best we have experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service & Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: CopperGlow
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in early June, and rate it as one of our most successful city breaks. The hotel is a modern building located just off the main road and tram route in the old city, close to the Grand Bazaar, and 5 - 10 minutes walk from the main sites of interest. All the facilities one would expect of a modern city hotel are provided, but what stood out was how friendly and helpful the staff are. A sense of personal attention is created, but without any feeling of intrusion. A buffet breakfast with a wide range of options is served in a light and airy room with views over the Sea of Marmara, and dinner is served in the relaxing atmosphere of the ground-floor restaurant. On mid-summer evenings, the restaurant operation is relocated to the roof-top terrace which provides wonderful views of the Sea of Marmara, the sun setting over western Istanbul, and the floodlit Blue Mosque & Hagia Sophia. Taking into account all the positive features, the whole stay was provided at an overall price that made it outstanding value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Best value in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: IstanbulMuses
Reviews.Content: The Best Western President is located in the city's oldest historic area, a few hundred meters from the wonderful Grand Bazaar and a short walk from nearly all of Istanbul's other must see sights. For a reasonable rate we got a very nice water view room, excellent beds, new bathroom, flat screen TV, safe, water view and delicious breakfast buffet included. The roof-top sun deck and restaurant has an incredible view overlooking Sultan Hamet (Blue Mosque) and the Sea of Marmaris. The staff are extremely helpful and professional, particularly Tulay in Guest Services and Erkan in Reception. We liked it so much we returned again for a few nights before we left Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “Functional city hotel in the heart of Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Traveller101_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights at the end of our honey moon. The hotel is what you would expect from a city hotel, adequately sixed rooms, clean, std facilities etc however what made it special was the friendly very attentive and eager to help staff. Breakfast- delicous and wide selection of cold and hot food. Literally 2 mins walk from the Great Bazar, and only 10 mins from Blue mosque and Haghia Sophia. Would recommend it to visitors.

Reviews.Title: “you can trust the positive reviews - excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: cameronclegg
Reviews.Content: Many of the 'good' reviews for hotels in Istanbul are questionable but we had a fantastic experience when we stayed here with our two children (aged 2 and 5). The location is great walking distance to the major sites and actually very quiet at night. We stayed in the president suite (cheaper than two adjoining rooms) which had a great view of the bosphorus and a terrace. The pool is smallish but usable and fine for kids. The rooms was very nice as you'd expect of a suite. All of the staff were genuinely friendly and very helpful. The only room for improvement would be at breakfast the coffee (horrible machine made) and the juice (longlife pasturized).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: peterwest7
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with excellent service,with everything you need to relax and unwind amongst the hustle and bustle of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best "hotel experiences", worldwide, in ten years.”
Reviews.Author: Cassius6
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in May 2010, en-route to a holiday in Cyprus. It`s a great location; 2 minutes walk from the "main road" , so quiet, but really central for the main tourist attractions, three tram stops away. Scrupulously clean, comfortable and well designed room. Of course the great plus, as always, was the helpful and friendly nature of the staff...we were sorry to leave. We did not eat (apart from excellent breakfasts) because we never eat in hotels, so cannot comment on food. Our only (tiny) critical point is that we would have liked more storage for clothes (drawers) in the room.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Western President Hotel is an excellent venue for business meetings in a beautiful, historic location.”
Reviews.Author: Dzhacon
Reviews.Content: The Best Western President Hotel was the venue for an international seminar I conducted on transmission system operations in July of 2008. The hotel staff was phenomenal in making all the necessary arrangements for both our accommodations and our meeting space. Their pricing was by far the best of the many hotels that I contacted in Istanbul as potential venues for my program. The hotel included an excellent breakfast in their restaurant which had stunning views of old Istanbul. The hotel's staff was eager to help me in all of my needs for the seminar including setting special, price-fixed menus to making certificates of achievement for the delegates participating in the seminar. On a personal note, the views from the hotel's rooftop restaurant were incredible, the location was within easy walking distance of many of Istanbul's most historic sites, including the Grand Bazar, the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia. I would gladly stay at the Best Western President Hotel again any time my business or personal needs take me to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Loud wedding on the 9th of May”
Reviews.Author: zxcop
Reviews.Content: Everything was nice except one thing. On the very evening of the 09th of May there was a huge wedding party with a loud music vibrating on the 6th floor while we stayed on the 5th. As we called Reception they simply said it will be over till midnight. How can I call it as a good consideration to the people living on the 5th floor? Playing loud music in a public areas of the hotel is not a good thing to do at that period of time. As we came back to the hotel at about 10-30 p.m. music had been playing already. And it really stopped not long before midnight. So was it a disco bar or a nice quiet hotel to stay in? I did not sort it out myself. The rest stay was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you!”
Reviews.Author: NinaDzyma
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™m very grateful to Best Western President hotel staff in Istanbul for everything they made for us before, during and even after our stay in Istanbul! I wish you the best and most pleasant tourists as your Hotel deserve this!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: denchris
Reviews.Content: My husband had booked this trip for my "special" birthday. The President Hotel was a brilliant choice - the location is ideal to see Istanbul being very close to the tramway and within walking distance to may of the attractions including the Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar! All staff were so friendly and very helpful, front desk staff were always so nice and happy to help with queries. It was such a pleasure to meet Ms Tulay Akar, Guest Relations, she always had a friendly smile and cheery "good morning" as you left the lifts in the morning and she was always so helpful with any queries and dealt with things immediately. She and the front staff were kind enough to organise a lovely surprise of a basket of fruit and a gorgeous cake to celebrate my birthday. The room and bathroom were very good, very clean and comfortable. All in all the hotel made our holiday a very memorable stay in Istanbul and I would certianly not hesitate to recommed it.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT PLACE TO STAY FOR NUMEROUS REASONS”
Reviews.Author: toberua
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel on our visit to Turke and enjoyed every minute of it. It is ideally located just two short blocks from the public Tram, and the Grand Bazaar. The tram is great to ride to the various tourist spots, as it is only two stops to the Blue Mosque and the Hagia Sophia, and only two more to the Old Spice Market and the riverfront of the Bospherous River. The staff at the hotel is excellant and the guest relations person, Ms. Tulay Akar, is about the most professional and helpful person of this category we have ever run up against. Her smile alone is enough to pull you trough whatever problems you encounter, and i can guarantee you if that doesnt work, she will surely solve your problem. The rooms have everyhing you could possibly want for a comfortable stay and are very very clean and roomy. The Old English Pub downstairs is a fantastic place to unwind and enjoy an ice cold Efes draft beer while taking in a soccer match on a big screen tv. All in all i am so very glad we picked this hotel and would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “Great location views and service”
Reviews.Author: NCH23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located within comfortable walking distance of many of the tourist spots. The pool and sun terrace on the top floor are lovely and have great views of the sea and Blue Mosque. We booked for a four night stay but, as a result of the volcanic eruption, we ended up staying for two weeks. Thanks to the efforts of the management and staff of the hotel what could have been a highly stressful situatuion was made as pleasant as possible. We were very grateful for all of the assistance we received from the reception staff in finding us a room each time we had to extend our stay. Also, the lovely lady on guest services could not have been more helpful. We were also very touched to receive a fruit basket and free use of the health club to cheer us up after our flight had been cancelled for a second time. We would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel. If you book the hotel through their website, courtesy transfer from the airport is provided. Our trip was organised by Trailfinders ( providers of a fantastic service and I would also highly recommend them), so we organised our transfers with Istanbulairport24 - I would use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location”
Reviews.Author: Riko09
Reviews.Content: This is a pleasant hotel, staff very helpful and ever willing. Great location too and accessible to all attractions. The hotel is a short walk downhill to the restaurants at Kumkapi, and 5 minutes from the tramway and Grand Bazaar. The only downside is that the wi-fi system was a disappointment with a weak and erratic signal. This should be top notch considering the per night rate of 119 euro.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Friendly Service was provided by the BW President Hotel”
Reviews.Author: missionalive
Reviews.Content: We held a conference at this hotel. I have been in charge of many conference and we have never had better service. They communicated with us as needed and even brought a piano into our meeting when I had forgotten to make arrangements. The meeting room and food was wonderful. The sleeping rooms were comfortable. The attention to detail and responsiveness to our needs whether it was transportation, food, electronic equipment was amazing. I plan to make this my hotel of choice every time we are in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: JohnJill_15
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia but on arrival (which was late in the evening as a suitcase went missing at the airport for an hour) we were told the hotel was overbooked as their website booking tool had not closed. They were very apologetic and paid for a taxi to take us and our friends to a sister hotel that had only been open 10 days - Amira Hotel. This was a boutique hotel and the rooms were outstanding - five star! Breakfast was superb. At lunchtime they arranged a taxi service to return us to the President Hotel. They gave us good rooms there for our final night, and paid for our dinner for four plus drinks in their restaurant. We could not have asked for better service. Would also recommend the Amira Hotel - fantastic rooms and staff and so close to the Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque.

Reviews.Title: “great venue great service!!”
Reviews.Author: magseast
Reviews.Content: Arrived at midnight and the service was great. Despite a problem with the room key and the type of room which was quickly resolved !! There was a nice bowl of fruit to welcome us , and the bar was still open so a good start. Good buffet breakfast on the top floor and attentive waiters to help . The hotel is in a good position and at the top of the street you can get on the tram to visit all the main sites or just walk across he road to the Grand Bazaar .We had a nice meal in the restaurant and the hotel sorted out our early morning ( 5-15am ) taxi to the airport!! would stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Dollar for dollar, great place!”
Reviews.Author: harmonyeternal
Reviews.Content: When I walked into my room, there was a small basket of fresh fruit for me. I knew then that I had made a very good choice. I spent far too much time searching for a hotel when I finally decided to go with a brand from the USA. When I looked at the photos originally, I felt comfortable with my choice. Then when I arrived and discovered 1) how close I was to transportation, 2) the hotel itself 3) the breakfast in the mornings I knew I had made a very good choice. The bed in the room was very comfortable and my view on the 4th floor was spectacular. My only teeny tiny frustration was that loggin in to the free wireless was sometimes spotty because you had to log in over and over so much. But it was free so my complaint is minimal. 5 stars

Reviews.Title: “Well located, clean and efficient hotel”
Reviews.Author: wearybanker
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at beginning of VJV 'grand' tour of Turkey (great tour, by the way), and final night 2 weeks later. Clean, well managed hotel, well located for central Istanbul sights. Restaurant a little pricey perhaps, and wine prices silly, but since only walking distance to myriad more reasonably priced dining venues, really not a problem. Would happily return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, except:”
Reviews.Author: ChristopheF3
Reviews.Content: The luxurious looks and name of the hotel are not what they should be.. But it's acceptable

Reviews.Title: “Good Location â€“ Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GOM99
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located a few minutes walk from the Grand Bazaar and a ten minute gentle stroll from the main sites â€“ Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace etc. The modern tram passes the top of the street and is a good way of getting back when tired or of getting to the harbour, railway station and attractions on the other side of the Golden Horn. It connects with the two funiculars going up to either end of the main shopping street. You buy a red token â€œjetonâ€� from a kiosk and use this to access the platforms â€“ it is a fixed fare (TL1.50 in early 2010) regardless of distance. The rooms are a good size but with little storage space â€“ they have a view over the Sea of Marmara to Asia. Breakfast is adequate but unexciting. There is a good restaurant, English Bar and Coffee Shop in the hotel. If you get a room with a connecting door ask to be moved. These are made of paper and you can hear every sound made in the next room. In the basement of the hotel, but accessed separately, is a large hall which has nightly shows â€“ there is a reasonable meal and entertainment â€“ folk dancing, whirling dervishes and no less than three different belly dancers. A bit expensive but if gives you an â€œinstant Turkeyâ€� experience. There are numerous restaurants and snack bars in the street around the hotel. One â€œconâ€� to avoid is that of the shoe cleaners. They will appear to lose their brush which you point out to them. They are delighted and offer to clean your shoes. They then say how bad times are so you feel guilty and want to pay them. They will then ask a huge sum â€“ in my case he started at Â£40 â€“ when I pointed out that the shoes only cost Â£25 he offered to help me find the money in my wallet. I told him to â€œeff-offâ€� and get his hands away and ended up paying him Â£4 â€“ the smallest note I had. I thought this was just an opportunistic con on me down by the harbour but when I saw it repeated right outside the hotel I realised it was an â€œinstitutionalised conâ€�. So, next time I will just pick up the brush and walk off with it and see what happens then!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: anastasia12385
Reviews.Content: After 5 days of a business conference in Istanbul staying in an other hotel, I moved to The President hotel to expand my journey in the city. The location is grate, just 3 minutes away from the tram station, 5 minutes walk from the Grand Bazaar and many other attractions. The staff was very welcoming and helpful, so they made our first impression of this hotel very good. Our room was on the fifth floor, spotlessly clean, not very spacious but comfortable, with all the amenities that we needed, and with a very comfortable bed. The breakfast was on the top floor, from where we had a spectacular view of Istanbul, and the variety of food was satisfying. Another plus is the free wi-fi internet access everywhere in the hotel. To conclude with, I would highly recommend this hotel to everyone, as I'm looking forward staying in this hotel if I ever have the chance to visit Istanbul again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel ... good location.”
Reviews.Author: globetrottah
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife in 12/08 for a week. It was a great hotel for our city break to explore Istanbul. Next to the Grand Bazaar and straight up the Divan Yolu from Sultanahmet sights (which we eaily walked to and also took the tram) it was set in a convenient location. The staff were friendly, and the breakfast was full of hot and cold choices and very good. The views from the roofdeck and breakfast room are great, and you'll have onlookers as you dine if you sit next to the window in the form of large seagulls who creepily stare at you while you eat through the glass! The decor of the rooms was modern and clean, the common areas of the hotel seem to be a tad stuck in the 1980's, so don't stay here if you are seeking a design hotel or luxury boutique hotel out of an interior design mag... but as I said, the rooms felt modern, clean and outfitted with modern amenities. I think we had a great stay all in all and I thoroughly recommend the hotel for an Istanbul vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Edesem
Reviews.Content: It is a fantastic place, with very friendly staff and perfect location. Breakfast was 5 star, rooms large and very clean and there was a fruit basket waiting for us. The only negative thing is that the pillows were not so comfortable. I can warmly recommend a massage by Omer in the Fitness Center. He went out of his way to fix my muscleproblem and even gave me extra time for free. Omer, if you read this, big THANKS! I loved this hotel and this will be the only hotel for me in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location even for families with little children!”
Reviews.Author: TLZZ
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our two small children (ages 3 and a15mnth old) during the christmas holidays. After intense research we selected this hotel based on reviews from here. We booked directly through the BestWestern hotel (not through the website as it wouldn't allow reservations for more than one child) and our sales rep Kerem Vural was a pleasure to deal with via e-mail. He was patient and very helpful in answering all our questions. As agreed we were met at the airport by the hotel arranged transportation (good sized and new van) and upon arrival to the hotel the check-in was quick and efficient. We were in Istanbul for only two days, and since the room we selected was not a suite, we had to arrange the furniture around a little so that all our luggage could fit and the kids had some room to move around. The check-in manager was kind enough to point out that we could leave our double stroller checked in at thier free luggage room which was heaven sent. The room was clean and the beds were comfortable, in addition to the 2 twin beds, they even arranged for an extra bed for our toddler. We had all the necessary amenities required for a stay. Breakfast on the 6th floor was amazing with lots of tasty varieties and the view of the Bosphorous was simply wonderful. Since we had a couple of wonderful and balmy sunny days, we were able to step out on the outdoor terrace (above the 6th floor, close to the pool) and take in the wonderful panoramic views. We didn't get a chance to use the pool, but it was rather small but looked inviting! Same goes for the fitness and spa area. The hotel did a great job arranging our transportation to the airport too. Just a note to poeple thinking of exchanging money...although the hotel do not charge a commission, they do give you a lower currency exchange and when I questioned it they mentioned it was higher than other hotels. I would reccommend getting currency converted at locations conveniently located by the grand bazaar and if you think of doing it at the airport they charge commission there too. As other reviewers have mentioned,the hotel was very conveniently located to just about everything we needed. A note for other parents with infants and or strollers--this hotel is located on a steep incline and going up or down may be rather challenging--depending on your circumstance. Going up to the main street where just about everything was located was easy, and although Istanbul sidewalks are not expected to be the same as in North America, it was fairly easy to navigate with a stroller. Going down to the fish market and restaurants was another adventure all toghether but we were glad we did it. Just a note to anyone thinking of taking taxis up/down the hill. Because of where the hotel is located and the routes the taxis need to take, it may not be worthwhile in terms of time and money to take one. All in all we were very glad we stayed at this hotel, and we look forward to coming back to Istanbul and staying here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: wajahatmr
Reviews.Content: It was in chilly January 2010 when I stayed in the Hotel. I was granted the room No. 415 on the 4th Floor. The rooms are comfortable, the view from my room was good, the room service was courteous. The best thing about Best Western The President Hotel is the location. it is between the Leather Wholesale Market and just opposite to Beyazit Mosque. The Grand Bazar is just opposite to the hotel, the tram stop is at 2 minutes walking distance. The view from the restaurant at the 6th floor is breathtaking. The small swimming pool at the 6th floor adds beauty to the view. Probably the room rent is well justified due to the convenience and the service.

Reviews.Title: “Comments on BW President, Istanbul Turkey”
Reviews.Author: NoorKarachi
Reviews.Content: I have been travelling to Istanbul for my business trips since January 2002, and have mostly stayed in the Sahilyolu / Zeytinburnu area. This is the first time that I stayed in the Beyazit area, which is very conviniently located in the 'old Istanbul' close to the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia and the Grand Bazaar, where one can do amazing shopping. The Bosphorous is also close by and can be looked upon from the rooms. For travel to other areas of Istanbul, cheap Metro transit is available footsteps from the hotel. Apart from the location, the hotel itself, its rooms, health club, breakfast and most importantly the hospitality by its staff was amazing and I would recommend this hotel strongly for anyone visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant service”
Reviews.Author: industrialarch
Reviews.Content: Hotel was everything we hoped for and made all the better by the brilliant service from all members of staff. When my husband hurt his leg while sightseeing, he was offered a crutch or a wheelchair and loads of ice to bring the swelling down. Nothing was too much trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: git_83703
Reviews.Content: This was a well maintained Hotel, with very helpful staff - Always willing to go the extra mile to make us comfortable. Only caveat was the noise - Walls are fairly thin, even with the upgraded room I had. But everything else was excellent

Reviews.Title: “OK - but not for us”
Reviews.Author: Mel1Sydney
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying there is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel. It is a perfectly acceptable, motel-style 3 star hotel in a pretty good location. We HATED it. It is brown and beige and soulless. The corridors had low ceilings and worn, dull carpets. The rooms also have low ceilings and inadequate lighting and the breakfast room looks like a bingo hall. We did not touch the cold meats at the breakfast buffet, they looked most unappetizing. The whole place is very 1970s and â€œplain creepyâ€� according to our 14 year old daughter. I thought staying in the best room in a mid-range hotel was a good compromise to the fact that the Four Seasons Sultanhamet was full (after research showing that the Sultanhamet was a great location for sightseeing, especially in late Oct when the weather was cooler â€“ rather than a resort style hotel on the Bosphorous). So we took the President Suite (3rd floor, room 324) and a standard room next to it for our daughter (rm 322). The PS was a really good size, like a junior suite in a 5 star hotel, with a separate sitting room, 2 TVs, queen bed (instead of the king we were expecting) and a partial view of the sea. The sheets were clean; the room seemed clean, but very worn. The bathroom was small â€“ one sink â€“ and more like a motel bathroom. As I said before, thereâ€™s nothing really wrong with this place, and I feel bad complaining yetâ€¦stillâ€¦.to us it was just awful! We hated the idea of going back there after a long day sightseeing. The English pub is dark and who knows what grimy sins are hidden in that darkness? We could not bear the thought of going to the Orient Restaurant with a touristy dinner show. After 2 nights we had enough and high-tailed it over to the Four Seasons on the Bosphorus. Yes, I know. From one extreme to the other but let me say, once ensconsed into the sublime FS, we REALLY enjoyed Istanbul!

Reviews.Title: “location ! location ! location”
Reviews.Author: hedy425
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hptel before our holyland cruise. The hotel is clean and friendly but the location is excellent. It is witihin 10 minutes walk of all the tourisr spots in Istanbul such as , Grand Bazaar Blue Mosque, Topkapi Plaace and Aya Sofia. The small cafe in the hotel has the best lamb I have ever tasted. The surrounding area is safe to walk around.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnelauraC
Reviews.Content: Very accomodating staff, great location, great value

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: hilcrossEssex
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 4 nights early october staff were friendly and helpful throughout all areas largest choice of breakfast i have seen anywhere dinner in restaurant was very good especially if you have the two for one offer. pool was small but adequate with bar and large sun terrace and the view!!! rooms clean and tidy and decent size overall an excellent hotel a bit on istanbul tram stop close to hotel very cheap and you can reach most places from here recommend the open fish stalls near galata bridge also dinner cruise on bosphorus overall a delightful experience and we would definity return

Reviews.Title: “Superb location if you like the shopping in the bazaar. Very nice view on the see.”
Reviews.Author: Angeltwo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located near the bazaar ( five minutes ) and the main monuments ( ten minutes by foot for Haghia Sophia ) of this part of Istanbul. We had a nive suite with superb view on the see. Clean, good breakfast and excellent service. The reception was very nice and helpful. Very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: yju
Reviews.Content: Excellent location,helpful staff,good breakfast and clean.Would definately stay there again

Reviews.Title: “above expectaions”
Reviews.Author: mathladyca49
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a large (70) group. Check in very efficient. 3 large elevators. Rooms very clean- but typically tourist- no ironing board, no coffee maker (had to ask for one as we found out some other rooms had them). Free wireless. Lovely rooftoop lounge area accessed to indoor pool ( small but refreshing) Pool towels available even at 5 pm. Breakfast had enough variety to satisy- no make it fresh stations but lots of fruit, eggs, cereals, yoghurts, breads, muffins etc. Unless you are used to turkisth coffee - mix it with hot water and bring your own tea bag- tea was very well steeped. Lots of juices. Had to fixed dinners here- average but water/coffee/tea all extra. Please- what does it cost for an urn of coffee? Wine prices reasonable. Great view of water and mosques from breakfast room and some hotel rooms. Small bar for late evening socializing. A notch above typical north american best westerns.

Reviews.Title: “Best Choice”
Reviews.Author: kirbyderb
Reviews.Content: After alot (and I mean alot!) of research, I decided on this hotel and I'm glad I did. I was traveling alone and concerned not just for location but also for safety and this place was great. The hotel was clean, the staff was super friendly and the breakfast in the am was excellent (I still miss the yogurt with fresh honeycomb!) I really liked the outdoor terrace where you could see the Blue Mosque and the Bosphrous. The pool is really small but it is nice to have one after a day on the hot, crowded streets of Istanbul. The best thing about this hotel is its location...everything is a short walk or a few tram stops away! And the rooms are surprisingly quiet...you can hear the prayer calls at night (which is quite soothing) from the nearby mosque but you don't hear alot of the street noise and hustle from the streets below...I was even able to sleep late on morning with no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service; convenient location; good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: IntlTvlr
Reviews.Content: During my stay, I received excellent service from the front desk and from the staff in general. One morning I had to go for a medical test & missed breakfast. When I came back, they arranged for complimentary tea and croissant. Staff also helpful with transit options even suggesting bus routes. Location is near many sites, and tram and bus stops are just two blocks up the hill. Lovely buffet breakfast with a wide-variety of Turkish and European choices. Many hotel guests are Europeans on tours. Both the pool (small) and breakfast room have views of the water. Rooms do vary in size and view.

Reviews.Title: “Good, clean and efficient hotel in the centre of Istanbul.”
Reviews.Author: vw
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and efficient. From the Ataturk airport, take the Metro to Zeytinburnu, 6 stops and 1.5TL. Then get on the tram for 14 stops and get off at Beyazit, another 1.5TL. Total of 3TL: 1.2 pound sterling. Try this in London!! The hotel is 160m from the Beyazit tram station. The total journey time was only 50 mins door to door! We had room 515 overlooking the wonderful west side of Istanbul and the sea. Watching the sunset around 7pm. And also partial view of the Beyasit Mosque. I think there were only two rooms better than this one, they were 517 and 519. Unless you have the President suite which is next to 519. 515 is also bigger than 501 as described by the previous TA. The only small improvement I think was that the receptions and the doorman could be a bit more friendly. When they tried to charge me the cans of nuts I did not eat when checking out, they were not happy at all. I found the breakfast more than sufficient. I am not that fussy. Ok, there were limited choice of hot food but there were plenty of bread, cakes, cereals and fruits. Oh, the tea and coffee were good as well. And the view was wonderful. We could see the sea, the Princes' Island (which I would highly recommend, very good for a day trip, take the fast ferry from Kabatas). Service was good and fast as well. The best Turkish restaurant we found near the hotel was just 10 mins walk down the hill towards the sea: Islamoglu: No 20 Buyuk Komurcu Sk. The meat balls and chicken wings were delicious and cheap. 5 to 6 TL per main course.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: travelingprincess3
Reviews.Content: First and foremost....the location was fabulous! A quick little walk (maybe a minute) and you are right there in the Grand Bazaar. Everything we had on our list to go and see or do in Istanbul was in walking distance from this hotel. We did not take one taxi ride or any alternate forms of transportation. We walked everywhere (and keep in mind, I'm a bit lazy at times....so if I can do it, anyone can). I can't say enough about Istanbul....I love it...but back to the hotel. We were very pleased with the hotel (the little amount of time we actually spent in it). We stayed here twice (beginning and end of our guided tour). The rooms were perfectly fine (clean with comfortable beds). We lucked out at the end of the tour and somehow got upgraded to a suite....so that of course was spectacular. The only downfall I would say would be the breakfast choices (well, what we American's are used to anyhow). I ended up with toast and cereal every morning. But so what....the location was FABULOUS!

Reviews.Title: “good stay in ideal oocation”
Reviews.Author: vlh66
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the second leg of our honeymoon, flying on from Athens into Istanbul. We had a superb hotel there and had we not experienced that we would have thought this was great. Having said that, we thought this hotel was very good. It is very well situated for all the essential sights of Istanbul- the blue mosque, Topkapi and Aghia Sofia and so on in walkable distance. The roof top terrace is lovely but the pool is very small. The rooms are quite small but everything you need is there- ask for an iron, adaptor, tea and coffee facilities and they will get them for you at no cost. The staff all speak good english and are very helpful and advise you honestly. A word about Istanbul- it takes a day to get used to it. It has a very thin veneer- you are on a very nice street- turn a corner and its a ghetto. But that's the way it is - it is safe, people are very friendly, going about their business but are definitely out to make a fast buck out of you. Always carry plenty of small notes/ change with you.. Always haggle, look at the change you are given-challenge it if its wrong. If you get large notes from the ATM change them at the hotel or go to somewhere reputable like MacDonalds and buy something. Even the official employees at the tram station tried to give us a defunct note! When challenged he gave us the right one- remember they only have to do it with 4 or 5 people a day and they make Â£20. Overall we really enjoyed Istanbul- its a very different place, exciting, bustling and quite amusing. Coming back to a reputable hotel makes it all the better.The English bar is somewhat of an oddity- i've never been in anything like it and i've lived in England for 40 odd years; clearly a Turkish take; It is 20 years behind in a make over. I would definitely suggest a trip across the Bosphorous to the North side of the Golden Horn to the Beyogulo district. You can get the normal boat for 60p which is a lovely break or just walk over the Galata bridge. It is more modern there with good bars and nightlife. We tried the Asian side but that was pretty dire.... The sights to see are by the hotel in essence but in the evening head to Sultanahmet or Beyogulo. Therefore you can't go far wrong with this hotel- clean, well situated, good staff and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel, very well located and with stunning view!”
Reviews.Author: TH4TT2010
Reviews.Content: Pleasant hotel, very well located and with stunning view The hotel is located off the main drag less than 400m from the Grand Bazaar and metro station. A plaque at the top of the street was the only way we knew where it was as the taxi driver had no idea where the street was, this was not uncommon. The service was very good in reception and the rooms clean but a little tired, a good 3 star I would say, and the cost to go with it! The roof top terrace has a great view over the Bosphorus , and an excellent way to unwind and relax. The non-alcoholic drinks as well as the hard stuff is quite expensive, but worth it for the view. I was apprehensive before and glad we stayed afterwards. I was a little disappointed with the breakfast, a good choice of cold but only 3 warm dishes. However, staying at 4 other hotels during our trip it was retrospectively quite good! And the view from breakfast room being adjacent to the terrace was great in the morning. The Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar etc. etc. are all close, we walked to most attractions in that area, but we could have easily caught the tram. The tram/ public transport system is worth mentioning as all trips whether 1 stop or 10 is 1.5 Turkish Lira, TRL. No high platforms and clean well kept carriages. The only thing to be wary of is which platform you need to be on, to go the way you require. There are parallel tracks so the frequency of the trams is excellent, but rushing for a tram you can easily pick the wrong platform and have to hop across the tracks when the tram has moved off. It is possible to get the tram and metro to and from the Ataturk Airport terminal to the hotel; we returned that way and there was 1 change of train from tram to metro. The station had a few steps but they were the only ones on the trip which took 50minutes. Total cost of journey to the airport 3 TRL each, <75p. Taxi from the airport was not too expensive at 40TRL but the stress of the taxi driver not knowing where we were going was not a good way to start the break. There was free parking under the hotel and the door man will park your car to keep the street clear, but you have to pick it up from the basement of the hotel yourself. Not an issue as it is close. One issue could be getting the car out, they shuffle the cars to bring yours to the front and if you were pressed for time you may have an issue. I am sure asking the night before would helpâ€¦ but I did not think of that. We thoroughly enjoyed Istanbul and Turkey, and had no complaints about the hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “excelent hotel , excelent location !”
Reviews.Author: mtex
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my friend at the best western president hotel on 25/05/09, we found the hotel very frendly, the location was perfect, we walked all over the old city ,2 woman alone and the neighborhood was frandly ,the room was clean, a little small but good enaght .the stuff was very helpfull and nice ! We recommend this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Not exciting but does the job”
Reviews.Author: Spurstraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a smashing week in Istanbul. Our first visit there and we loved the city. The President Hotel is well situated being near all of the main sights of the city centre and the million and one shops of Istanbul; two minutes walk from a tram stop and only five minutes walk from a restaurant area with literally hundreds of tables. Our first room was a reasonable size but with a view only of the room opposite - so we asked to be moved and this was done straight away with ansolutely no probems and we had a larger room with a superb view over the sea. The staff were all very helpful all of the time. Breakfast was good (if unimaginative) with plenty of choice of cold or cooked food, cereals, toast etc. The restaurant was OK but their so-called "English Pub" is unlike any English pub that I have ever been in and, as others have said, apart from the local lager, it is not cheap. Overall I would say that there was nothing to complain about but nothing to get particularly excited about either. The hotel is a typical middle range international hotel - highly serviceable but lacking in character - it could have been anywhere. However, if you are looking for a decent centre for touring Istanbul then it would be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not advisable "expensive"”
Reviews.Author: nameish
Reviews.Content: The hotel location was excellent, so near to Sultanahmed Mosque and other attractions (all walking distance), the down sides to it are as follow; rooms & bathroom are so small, there are no balconies, and no tea/coffee facilities in the room. We asked for 2 coffees and got charged Â£10.00 !!!!!. the next day we had one brandy at the English Pub (within the hotel) and got charged Â£17.00, they will charge for the use of sauna

Reviews.Title: “Just now good”
Reviews.Author: SrVlad
Reviews.Content: It was our 5th stay in Istanbul. We have used different hotels but this was the worth. Location is not bad but you can find much better and with very nice views. We have good a single room but we have booked double one. We have stayed only one night and than moved to another hotel. The room was very simple and not 4 star at all (2 stars max). But the main problem was noise. We could not sleep. It was elevator or air conditioning system. The small window we had faced a wall. Just not good.

Reviews.Title: “Love at first sight”
Reviews.Author: aparnarya
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally located in the old part of Istanbul, within walking distance of all the sights like Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, the University and the Grand Bazaar.... Its also very conveniently houses a restaurant, which gives you a brief glimpse of all the entertainment and culture in Turkey. the Orient something... Sorry can't remember the name for the life of me... The sea is also close by and so is all the fresh seafood you can eat....

Reviews.Title: “Good base for historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Geraldo_Bonzo
Reviews.Content: The President Hotel is well situated for the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and the tram system. It's a nice hotel off the main road in the middle of the leather quarter. Be brave and take a stroll around some of the surrounding back streets and see where the leather shoes, jackets and bags are made ... and get a much better deal than in the Bazaar! Rooms were fine although the walls a little paper thin but the overall quality was good. The buffet breakfast was substantial and very busy. Prices for drinks in the bar are very expensive but wander down the road and you'll find a mini-mart where things are much cheaper. There is a very small pool which is free but other facilities like sauna cost 10 YTL per day.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at BW President”
Reviews.Author: TwotogoinSC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Best Western President for a week at the end of March/early April. The rooms were clean and a decent size. Bathroom was also a good size and included a hairdryer. The room also has a refrigerator which is nice. You can buy some drinks at local grocery stores and keep them cool in your room for later. Breakfast was offered every morning (included in room rates) and was a good value - lots of choices. They offered breakfast until 10. Breakfast is offered in the Marmara Room which overlooks the local neighborhood and the Sea or Marmara. Hotel is about two blocks from the nearest tram stop, but it is very easy to get there. You basically walk up the street two blocks and cross the main drag and you're there. Plus, the Grand Bazaar is also across the same main street. Once you're on the tram, it takes minutes to get anywhere. Even if you're walking, the main sites are approximately ten minutes away. The hotel was very helpful before our stay. They made two dinner reservations for us and also obtained an Akbil (rechargeable tram pass) for us. They made additional reservations for us during our stay and were generally very helpful when we had questions or needed assistance. Two slight negatives - the walls, especially in the bathroom, could be thin at times. It never interfered while we were trying to sleep but I did notice it in the mornings when the people in the rooms next door were getting ready in the bathroom. The second negative is that the hotel does not offer free transportation unless you book through their website and stay a certain number of nights. They have since changed that a little since we booked - I'm guessing bookings are probably down due to the economy. One other nice touch - the hotel offers two free waters a day for you to use. We used one to brush our teeth and took the other with us sightseeing. Overall, a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great value”
Reviews.Author: AlexTara
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a great base for a visit to Istanbul. It is only a short walk to the grand bazaar and blue mosque. Very clean hotel with friendly staff. Spa area is very small though and they charge 20 euros per person to use it. Overall though, the hotel is highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: MojacarSpencers
Reviews.Content: We spent the end of December and the beginning of 2009 at this hotel and we were delighted with our choice. The staff were very helpful, friendly and spoke excellent English. Our booking was for a standard double room and we were expecting it to be very small as some reviews had inferred this and so we were pleasantly surprised to find that it wasn't that small at all. The bathroom was spotless and well equipped. There was sufficient hanging space for clothes and two chairs and a small table. There were a variety of TV channels though not many music channels to relax to. The hotel is so convenient for a variety of reasons: there is a tram stop approx. 5 minutes away. Heading towards the Marmara Sea there are plenty of restaurants (though you do run the gauntlet of all the touts trying to get you into their establishment!) On our first evening we actually bartered for our dinner - great fun, delicious fish and excellent value for money. Most of the major monuments are all within walking distance of the hotel and it's not far if you want to catch a ferry boat. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our 5 nights at the President Hotel though there was one negative which will only effect clients who stay on New Years Eve; as we booked a package deal, we were obliged to go to the New Year's Eve Gala Dinner at a cost of 83 euros a head. We were very disappointed with the food (5 courses but all very uninteresting) and there was very little atmosphere as we were placed on tables of mixed nationalities with no common language so no-one really spoke to each other. It was a slight downer especially as we would probably had a much better time enjoying the atmosphere of Taksim Square.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice”
Reviews.Author: Blueshed
Reviews.Content: A free up-grade to the Presidential Suite on our first night - OK for us, we didn't mind moving the next day. The President is in a great location, a short walk to the Grand Bazzar and near tram stops to everywhere else.The facilties are great, the staff friendly, lots of food at breakfast and the views over the Bosphoros from the roof terrace are magnificent. You can lie on your back in the small roof top pool and see the Blue Mosque through the roof glass - though the water is not what I'd call 'heated' - keep swimming then head down to the sauna and jacuzzi. We ate in the restaurant a couple of times - good value , amusing waiters. If you want to buy cushion covers the hotel shop ones are better and cheaper than in the Bazzar and children's belly-dancing costumes are cheaper and better in the airport shop. Shop around for the best price to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: ArtHistoryTeacher
Reviews.Content: Very good location just a short block from the Grand Bazaar, and less than a 10 minute walk to main cultural sites. Staff was helpful and pleasant. Rooms (I stayed there twice) were spacious and comfortable, and had large bathtubs. Hotel had many nice facilities. It was clean and safe. The included breakfast was fabulous with a large variety of just about anything you could wish for. The one dinner I had in the restaurant was very nice too. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Istanbul is just great!”
Reviews.Author: Babydeey
Reviews.Content: I absolutely recommend this hotel because we spent lovely moments there. The location is great, near the Grand Bazar , the staff very friendly (very good English) , the room clean and the bad fantastic. We also enjoyed the breakfast (a great variety of food) and the panorama from the "Marmara Room".

Reviews.Title: “excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: SladjanaSerbia
Reviews.Content: I was looking something to run away from every day uniformity of life with my husband. Also i wanted to see something different, have some fun, meet nice people and have a pleasant staying like i'm home. At first Best Western President Hotel seems like a nice choice. I looked some reviews and some of the pictures made by people who already was in this hotel. So i decided - that's it. But when we came it seems not like nice but EXCELLENT CHOICE. People were very pleasant and at the same time very professional.They were waiting for us at the airport. Arrange the transportation from the airport to the hotel. We have a possibility to choose a room.Everything was more than we were expected. Room was very clean, so the bathroom. They changed bedding and towels everyday, and cleaning the room, too. We had a breakfast in the hotel. Food is fresh and various.Coffee is excellent. We were also in the English pub which is in the hotel - we recommend it - it's very nice. We used fitness center - gym and the swimming pool. But you have jacuzzi, sauna, steam room and massage, too. In the gym professional trainers were waiting for us. So it was very nice surprise. Pool is not very big, but it's comfortable and the temperature of the water is acceptable. As you can see on the pictures, the view is inappreciable - Marmara sea and historical Istanbul. We were thrilled with location of the hotel. Everything that you need to see in old Istanbul is very close to hotel. University of Istanbul, Topkapi Palace, St.Sophia, Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar, Old city, Spice bazaar, even the Galata Bridge is not so far away. We got a map of old Istanbul at the reception of the hotel, so it was easier and faster for us to go round and to see all interesting places. When the time of checking out came personnel of the hotel was very professional.We finished checking out and paying our bills in about 5 minutes. Our transportation already was waiting for us to take us to the airport. Everything was arranged in advance. So, if you read this review of mine carefully, you can make a simple conclusion. IF YOU WONT A SPLENDID VACATION, IN THIS CASE IN ISTANBUL, YOU HAVE TO CHOSE BEST WESTERN PRESIDENT HOTEL TO BE YOUR HOST. Greetings for all of you who chose this hotel !!! We will chose it again. That's for certain.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location - Rooms need refurbishment”
Reviews.Author: EZT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, you are within a couple of minutes to the door of the Grand Bazaar and within 15 minutes walk to the Blue Mosque area. The rooms are OK for a 4 star hotel but need to be redone. The TV is 14 inch box. Very few channels and poor reception. Internet access is complimentary and not available in all rooms (I had to go down to the lobby which is a nuisance). Breakfast is excellent at the top floor.Enjoying the excellent views of the strait while having breakfast was a plus. It is not the best in Istambul and probably for the same price you can get something a bit more upmarket but it is a perfectly adequate base if you are not too critical of the hotel flaws. Staff were a problem. Unhelpful and rude at times. They should work on that.

Reviews.Title: “Good Clean and Basic accommodation”
Reviews.Author: docvwLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as an extension to a tour to South Africa using Turkish Airlines and stayed at the Hotel President for 3 nights. It is excellently situated if you want to vist the sites of the Old City, and literally 3 minutes walk from the Tram line - Beyazit. 5 minutes takes you on foot to the Grand Bazaar and 15 minutes on foot to the Blue Mosque and the Haghia Sophia. The Hotel boasts an "English Pub" which is decked out in Scots tartan! It has a Grill restaurant and the first night we were offered a free meal by the Tour Company. In the event that this happens to you - expect to be disappointed as the food offered was extremely mediocre. Breakfast however was reasonable. The rooms were of average size, with a nice bathroom - no immediate view, but sea in the distance. There was little to complain about re the room, but nothing to get excited about either. Walls were thin - so best avoided for those romantic breaks! The top floor pool was said to be very pleasant by others in our group. All in all - good clean reliable accommmodation in an excellent location for sightseeing, but nothing to set the pulse racing...

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: helen-patricia
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from a 5 day trip to Istanbul where I stayed at the Best Western President Hotel. The trip was a city break with my sister and we had a twin room at The President. The hotel is located in a central convenient location tho quite a steep hill if you have walking/mobility issues. There's a tram stop just at the top of the hill (Beyazit) and the tram service is fantastic. Clean, regular and easy to use. You just buy a token for each journey for 1.40 YTL - just over 50p at current exchange rate - put this in the coin operated turnstile on the tram stop and then when the tram arrives you get on. We found it clean, air conditioned and regular. Very impressed........ The hotel itself is well laid out, rooms clean and well decorated and I found bed comfy. There's a spa on the top floor which costs 10euros for each use. It has a steam room, sauna, jacuzzi and a small pool which (according to my sister) was quite chilly - you can use pool for no charge. You are provided with a bathrobe, slippers and a towel and lockers to store your belongings and they have an area for you to relax on loungers. Massages are available for an addtional cost - we didn't have one. After a long day schlepping up and down the hills and roads of Istanbul the spa is nice to come back to and not too expensive. The rooftop bar has a fantastic view over Istanbul and the Marmara Sea but whilst we were there was too chilly to eat out on at night which was a shame. The breakfast was more than adequate and featured scrambled eggs, hot dog sausages and boiled eggs every morning along with cereals, a great selection of breads and pastries, crossaints etc. There's also a toaster (albeit a very slow one) and jams, honey, fruit, yoghurts, fruit juices, coffee & tea, cheeses, cold meats. We did use the "English Pub" on our first night but found the prices very expensive - worked out at about Â£7.50 for a bacardi & coke. However, we found that alcohol very expensive in all of the restaurants we ate at. Apart from breakfast didn't eat in hotel. Restuarants down the road at Kumkapi area very pretty but be prepared for some serious hassling by the restuarants to get you in....... Also not overly impressed with the food which we found quite expensive for what you got and not what I would call traditional Turkish food. I live in an area of North London where we have a lot of good Turkish restaurants and i was quite disappointed by standard of food we got there.
