Hotel staff were helpful and friendly and when I accidently left my jacket in the business center after using the internet it had been handed in and kept by reception who handed it back to me after a short description by me. Use of internet is free and there are 6 terminals in the business center tho internet connection a bit patchy. Overall I would definately recommend this hotel to any visitors to Istanbul. The 5am call to prayer would take some getting used to if you were here for an extended stay but I suspect this would be the same all over Istanbul. The Grand Bazaar is literally just up the road and well worth a visit - be prepared for some serious hassling and haggling - we loved it and had a good rapport with the traders. I would definately return to The President if I went to Istanbul again.......

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: derbyshirenomad
Reviews.Content: The hotel was perfectly situated with the grand bazaar, blue mosque, ayia sofia and bascilla cistern minutes walk away. With the addition of the tram stop minutes away that will take you to the port and over to the north side of Istanbul, you could not get better positioning for the hotel. The views over the marmara sea and blue mosque from the roof terrace were beautiful, particularly at sunset. The health centre was very good value with a free visit given to us by the hotel. Although the pool was very cold and quite small, it was nice after the sauna, steam room and jacuzzi. The room was on the fourth floor looking onto the marmara sea with a private balcony and it was excellent. Very modern, exceptionally clean and well maintained. The breakfast was very nice although it did not vary greatly day to day. My only criticism is the price /quality of the food and drinks whilst inside the hotel, along with the 'English Pub' which bears no resembelance to any english pub i have ever been into. But apart from that, excellent hotel and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very central”
Reviews.Author: murrbren
Reviews.Content: Great central hotel. View from the top of the hotel is great and we often went up there to enjoy the view and have a drink. Pool not to big, more of a plunge pool but I often saw it being used. The hotel is only minutes away from the bazaar and the tram is easy to use and very very close. Everyone at the hotel friendly and helpful . We would definitely return to this hotel if we returned. We stayed for 5 nights and had a lovely clean room. Lots of eating places nearby. Went to the Orient restaurant right next door to have a meal and watch belly dancing. It was a great night out. Loved it as it was for us something really different.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: kevinpng
Reviews.Content: I cannot fault this hotel. Excellent location, excellent staff and very good rooms. I had no noise problems and found the hotel overall to be of an exceptional standard for a Best Western. The location is perfect - easy walk to the Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar and many other locations in the old town. Given the price of many hotels in Istanbul, this property represents excellent value for money. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Samriz
Reviews.Content: Very Impressed with the hotel. Great location, Excellent service, tasty buffet breakfast, beautiful view of Marmara Sea, rooms comfortably furnished, very helpful & curteous staff. Had a fantastic holiday in Turkey.

Reviews.Title: “a very average hotel!”
Reviews.Author: saffronLondon
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is good, with the tram station only 3 minute walk away. The breakfast was lovely and the views from the dining room stunning. However there were many negative points: 1) Sound proofing is awful and you can hear your neighbours talk! 2) Don't pick the 5th floor as the noise from the dining room above is disturbing. 3) Food at the terrace restaurant is expensive and average quality. However the views are memorable. 4) Don't let the waiter take your credit card out of sight(they do have a mobile machine for that purpose). When we complained at the reception, the guy was rude and dismissive. Overall it is a disappointing hotel and I wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good but overpriced hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveller_spain
Reviews.Content: I stayed 6 nights in Istanbul, 3 at the BW President and 3 at the Barcelo Saray which is very near and both are 4 stars. - HOTEL: looks new, comfortable, big reception area, with restaurants and bars, shop, small swimming pool, sauna (10 euros fee), free WIFI and business room with 4 computers. Friendly and helpful staff. Great views to Marmara Sea from the roof. - ROOM: I got a clean, big and comfortable room with big bathroom. It is very silent at night but ask for a room far from the lift, otherwise people coming late night will bother you. You have free WIFI. - BREAKFAST: insufficient for this hotel category/price. Not enough choice of warm dishes (no bacon or sausages) and fresh fruit, no fresh juices. - LOCATION: located close to Bezayit Square and Grand Bazaar. It is at a walking distance to most highlights in the old city and you have a tram stop just 100 meters away. The street is quite dark at night, but I think it is safe. - AIRPORT TRANSFER/DROP-OFF: if you stay 3 nights or more and book it through their page you get this service free. During the 3 nights at the BW (may 8th to the 11th) there was a bank holiday in France and the F1 price was going on, so the prices were very high (119, 149 and 149 euros each night for a single room) and most similar hotels with better prices were full. Anyway, it seems it is their standard rate. I paid 80 for the Barcelo Saray and with the exception of the room size and got an slightly better hotel. If you get a room for less than 100 euros you may find convenient to go here, otherwise for that price you can get better deals.

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: ZazaCT
Reviews.Content: Reading reviews and exploring the hotel website convinced us to book this hotel and we were not disappointed. Through the website, I learned that the hotel will pick you up at the airport in a van for only 25 euros total, not per person. We gladly took advantage of this service and a driver was waiting for us when we landed at the Istanbul airport at 1 a.m. While he did not speak English, he was very friendly and helpful with our excessive amount of luggage. The hotel staff was waiting for us, friendly and fluent in English. Our non-smoking room, while not very large, was perfectly fine, clean and comfortable as was the bathroom. We had been traveling a long time and enjoyed nice hot showers. We were also happy to find a stocked mini-bar. After sleeping very well in the comfortable bed, we enjoyed a buffet breakfast in a rooftop dining room with stupendous views. The breakfast was so-so, but that's not why we chose this hotel. After checking out, the hotel stored our luggage and we explored on foot. The hotel is very well located!! We walked to the Blue Mosque in less than 15 minutes and from there to the Haj Sophia and an underground cistern (amazing). In the afternoon, we shopped at the Grand Bazaar, which was practically across the main road nearest the hotel. While in Istanbul, you might also consider taking in a dinner show at the Orient House (next door to the hotel) While pricey, we did enjoy it. Beware, smoking is allowed. We had a cozy table for two, which was a little elevated and separate from most other tables so that helped. There were 3 bellydancers and several folk dancing and musical performances as well as a whirling dervish. The food was fine. So, it was probably worth it. In short, I would definitely return to this hotel. It was certainly a very good value and met all our needs more than satisfactorily!

Reviews.Title: “I'd stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: Nastassie
Reviews.Content: It is very hard to choose the hotel in Istanbul, as it is a huge city situated in 3 parts. But we were very satisfied with our choise. It is conviniently located, close to Grand Bazaar, many coffee shops, Sophia mosque is also within walking distance. We loved the breakfast. Breakfast room is situated on the top floor with a nice view to the sea. The choise of food is very big and they also serve hot chocolate! Every morning they put in your room a newsletter with information about city, people, thing to do and tips. It is very well made and was very helpful. The only thing that was a little disappointing that it is a chain hotel that is missing a touch of local feeling. You know what I mean? Something traditional to Turkey... Otherwise, our stay stay was very enjoyable and I recommend it to the Istanbul explorers.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: scouse22
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a three night stay would reccommend this hotel and would definatly stay there again. Great location very close to some of the amazing attractions in Istanbul for example the grand bazaar and the blue mosque and the underground cistern. The bus service was great turn right when you leave the hotel and two minutes walk and you are at the bus station take the 61b which takes you to taskim square only 1.5 turkish lira each way you can pay on the bus. We took a one and half hour cruise down the Boshorus excellent take your camera booked at hotel very reasonable pick up to and from hotel and english speaking guide. Plenty of resturants and bars within minutes from hotel turn left and walk down the street follow round to left and bingo you are spoilt for choice. Or if you prefer plenty of bars and discos in Taskim get of Taskim Square and cross road to main shopping street you will not be disapointed. The hotel was fabulous staff very helpful nice beakfast on 6th floor Marmara room great views from the balcony here. Lovely pool small but sufficent for a refreshing dip and spotless also on 6th floor. Room was very nice lovely bathroom beds were fine and again spotless cleaned daily. Hotel staff were excellent very helpful and friendly we were greeted by a lovely young lady on reception 10 out of 10 for customer service. If you book this hotel direct from hotel web site you get a free transfer from the airport we were picked up on time and it is private so no stop off at other hotels excellent. Would recommend this hotel A+++

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: natul15
Reviews.Content: We have spent 4 days in the President hotel. The hotel is very good and has very good service . It is situated very comfortable-10 minutes from historical places.They had good breakfast,nice restaurant.The pool is lovely, but small.Tuere is turkish bath in the hotel.We paid 78 EURO per night for a room breakfast included. Overall I would say it is very good hotel for for staying.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: nicu
Reviews.Content: + Very good location in the center of the old town. Good price (our rate was about 300 Euro for 4 nights for double room with breakfast). Beautiful view from the breakfast room, gym and pool. Close to the airport - 20 mins taxi. - Small and shabby room. Average breakfast. Not very friendly staff. Each person implies about tips for everything. A barman holds a grudge if you don't order alcohol but just asks for a soda. Small gym and very small pool with very warm water. Conclusion: good choice if you book this hotel at rate below 100 euro per night.

Reviews.Title: “everything nearby”
Reviews.Author: traveloldie
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, near everything in Sultanahmed and the Big Bazar which is very nice, but if you have booked a cheaper room you 're becoming also the cheapest location in the hotel itself, low floor without view and much street noise, also noise of the tv of your neighbours because of the thin walls. Roomprice is high for Turkey, but perhaps not for Istanbul. The breakfast was good, but you have to hurry each morning for a table, it was very crowded. I did not liked the beds, they were too hard for me, our room was very small with only one comfy chair, but furthermore ok, also the bathroom. Ask for a watercooker on your room, they give it for free. The restaurant downstairs is good and nice, but expensive with small portions. Next time I will stay there again, but will not book on Agoda again, because you have no choise to book for a better room. Also I will ask to see the room first.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to make you beautiful lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: melody_e_shiraz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really in the best location of the istanbul. the breakfast is excellent and you can perfectly enjoy it in the highest floor of the hotel with the most beautiful view of the marmara sea. The bar is also good but the resturant is to some how expensive,although it is well decorated,and the food is good. By the way,I will choose the president again whenever I plan to travel to istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “More like a 3 star”
Reviews.Author: Mi-Aah
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for one week begining July 27, 2007. We booked this hotel based on the brochure photos, the star ratings and the prior reviews from previous guests. The hotel is definitely in a key location, within walking distance to the major attractions and cafes, which is where we ate breakfast. Firstly, I must commend the excellent concierge staff! They are very professional, polite and helpful and are truly the best thing about this hotel by far. The hotel is quite dated with old carpeting, walls needing painting and dark hallways. The elevators barely fit 2 couples. When we first checked in, the room we were given was quite small and had a very poor view looking into the interior courtyard from the second floor with workmen doing renovations. Before we set our bags down, we asked for a better room and our porter immediately called concierge to request another and even went to make the change for us while we waited. Our second room was only slightly larger, but at least we had a better view. There is almost no space for one suitcase, let alone 2. The closet is also quite small. We felt this hotel was more like a 3 star because the aged appearance. They were also laying down new carpeting right outside our door and in the hallway but it looked just as old as the one they were replacing. There is no coffeemaker or kettle provided in the room. We had no issues with the a/c. The bathroom is also small and dated, there were only soap dispensers in the shower and by the sink. One morning after both the soap and shampoo dispensers ran dry, the supervisor came to ask if room service was ok, so I mentioned the empty dispensers. He opened the dispenser and I'm sure went directly to inform housekeeping. Well, when we returned, it had been filled, but soap was put in the shampoo dispenser and the shampoo put in the soap dispenser. So if you are going to room 242, beware! Only other complaint is that they forgot to replace the face towels, but we did not complain as we figured they would be replaced the next day and they were. The breakfast was pretty bad in our opinion. I went only once and never went back! It was all cold-cut meats, tea/cofee that was self-service, bread, cereals and 2 different fruit, one being watermelon. The self-service scrambled eggs were runny and the hard-boiled eggs were more soft than hard. You must visit the rooftop for the fantastic and unbeatable view unless you have a room near the top. We loved Istanbul and would go back, but not to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “In Istanbul - We won it five times”
Reviews.Author: Buckshee
Reviews.Content: Average 4 star hotel with a nice bar and an above average breakfast selection. Beautiful rooftop pool area with magnificient views of the city. Adjacent to the Blue Mosque and Ideally located for most of the other top tourist attractions and the main tram line is just 50 yards from the front door. Major plus was the fact that they allowed us check in at 9am after a long flight despite the fact that it was advertised as not before 2pm. Minus points: Shower so pleasant it took the room-mate an inordinate amount of time to get ready. Plus points: We won it five times Pee !!!

Reviews.Title: “Standard 4* hotel, excellent location”
Reviews.Author: DutyManager1
Reviews.Content: This is a typical 4* hotel in Istanbul, but wiht a great location, only a few steps from the bazaar and a few minutes from the Blue Mosque. The location was the main reason to book this hotel, and we were very pleased. The rooms are standard, nothing special. The airco was working 70%, not full power, which we really needed during the summer The beds are too hard and I did not have 1 comfortable night (and we stayed 8 nights!!!!) You have a superb view over the bosporus from the restaurant where breakfast is served, but the breakfast could be improved upon: few choices, and very boring. they also have a problem with the coffee machines We got a free transfer from the airport upon arrival, which was a bonus

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: haod
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from istanbul,The President Hotel. This is one of the finest hotels I have ever stayed in, and I highly recommend it. From the moment you check in, the staff is at your side making sure your stay is exceptional. I canâ€™t say enough. If you find yourself in Istanbul, stay here, you will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: durs
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, friendly helpful staff. Room was new and clean with a great view. Breakfast was good too. I booked through hotel website upon arrival at airport, and called them for airport pick-up (offered free with two night stay) and was told to take yellow cab and they would pay for it at reception. Hotel website offered $99 u.s./night, not terribly expensive for this place. Upon checkout, I produced pre paid best western cards that were unfamiliar to the desk person, whom immediately got on the phone and internet to take care of everything with grace and a smile.

Reviews.Title: “another champion stay in istanbul!!!”
Reviews.Author: red kop
Reviews.Content: have just spent 3 wonderful days in istanbul, was there for the 2nd time in 3 years, to watch my team, liverpool f.c. could not have chosen a better hotel than the best western president, from the moment we arrived the staff were brilliant, we had a side room but you still had very good views of the sea of mamaris, plus the beyazit mosque..the facilities were very good, from the roof terrace a brilliant view of old istanbul, also a top class breakfast buffet, the reception has a wonderful coffee bar with water features,+ it was a change to be in an english theme bar that was'nt too false!!the grand bazaar is about a 5 minute walk away, also down the hill from the hotel is an area called kumkapi, where you will find many restaurants, many selling fish freshly caught that day!!! the blue mosque is about a 10 minute walk away, just follow the tram lines..all in all another wonderful stay in istanbul,+ staying at the president certainly helped!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Breakfast @ Location”
Reviews.Author: Raystravels
Reviews.Content: We flew with Easyjet and landed at an airport on the Asian side so could not take advantage of the free taxi the hotel had offered in its package. The hotel was hard to find at first, but on doing so all we found was excellent service, clean well looked after rooms, fantastic breakfast served with rooftop views of the sea. Always a welcome on returning from sightseeing and helpful reception staff. The Grand Bazaar is only a few hundred yards away as is an excellent tram line to take you for a fare of 1.3 lire, approx 50p. Well worth considering if you want to stay in the old part of Istanbul
